column2: d
$x_{1}$ is made of/contains/is a quantity of coffee from source/bean/grain $x_{2}$.
column3: Brew based on a seed/bean/grain; e.g. also chicory coffee, decaf, postum. See also {tcati}, brewed from a leaf, {barja}, {cakla}.

column2: $x_{1}$ has/is characterized by property/feature/trait/aspect/dimension $x_{2}$ (ka); $x_{2}$ is manifest in $x_{1}$.
column3: Manifested/property/quality/trait/feature/aspect (= {selkai}).  See also: cmavo list {kai}, {ka}; {tcaci}, {tcini}. Need not be a defining property (which is what "characterize" means in English).

column2: $x_{1}$ is a bed/pallet of material $x_{2}$ for holding/supporting $x_{3}$ (person/object/event).
$x_{1}$ is perilous/dangerous/potentially harmful to $x_{2}$ under conditions $x_{3}$.
column3: $x_1$ is a danger/peril to $x_2$.  See also te {bandu}, te {kajde}, te {marbi}, se {snura}, se {xalni}.

column2: $x_{1}$ ridicules/mocks/scoffs at $x_{2}$ about $x_{3}$ (property/event) by doing activity $x_{4}$ (event).
$x_{1}$ feels ashamed/mortified/humiliated under conditions $x_{2}$ before community/audience $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a key fitting/releasing/opening/unlocking lock $x_{2}$, and having relevant properties $x_{3}$.
column3: Also $x_2$ fastener, mechanism; code key (= {termifckiku}, {kiktermifra}); $x_3$ is dependent on the type of key, but are those form properties of the key that enable it to serve the function of opening the lock - in the case of a metal key to a padlock, for example, this would be the shaft and teeth.  See also {stela}.

column2: $x_{1}$ (si'o) is a scale of units for measuring/observing/determining $x_{2}$ (state).
$x_{1}$ is related to/associated with/akin to $x_{2}$ by relationship $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is grateful/thankful to/appreciative of $x_{2}$ for $x_{3}$ (event/property).
$x_{1}$ is school/institute/academy at $x_{2}$ teaching subject(s) $x_{3}$ to audience/community $x_{4}$ operated by $x_{5}$.
$x_{1}$ is a conifer/pine/fir of species/strain $x_{2}$ with cones $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is loud/noisy at observation point $x_{2}$ by standard $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is long in dimension/direction $x_{2}$ (default longest dimension) by measurement standard $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is without/lacking/free of/lacks $x_{2}$; $x_{1}$ is $x_{2}$-less.
$x_{1}$ is a moss/lichen of species/strain $x_{2}$ growing on $x_{3}$; (adjective:) $x_{1}$ is mossy.
$x_{1}$ (event) is early by standard $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is polite/courteous/civil in matter $x_{2}$ according to standard/custom $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ leaves/goes away/departs/parts/separates from $x_{2}$ via route $x_{3}$.
column3: Also: $x_1$ leaves behind/takes leave of $x_2$.  See also {litru}, {canci}, {vimcu}, {lebna}, {muvdu}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a loop/circuit of $x_{2}$ [material].
column3: Also noose (= {skoclupa}, {saljgeclupa}; there is no indication of shape, but merely that the ends join/meet); closed curve defined by set of points (= {cuptai}).  See also {djine}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a mathematics of type/describing $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is small in property/dimension(s) $x_{2}$ (ka) as compared with standard/norm $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a mountain/hill/mound/[rise]/[peak]/[summit]/[highlands] projecting from land mass $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a structure word of grammatical class $x_{2}$, with meaning/function $x_{3}$ in usage (language) $x_{4}$.
column3: $x_4$ may be a specific usage (with an embedded language place) or a massified language description; $x_3$ and $x_4$ may be merely an example of cmavo usage or refer to an actual expression; cmavo list, if physical object (= (loi) {ma'oste}); referring to the mental construct (e.g. propose adding a new cmavo to the cmavo list = {ma'orpoi}, {ma'orselcmi}, {ma'orselste}).  See also {gismu}, {lujvo}, {gerna}, {smuni}, {valsi}.

column2: $x_{1}$ (quoted word(s)) is a/the name/title/tag of $x_{2}$ to/used-by namer/name-user $x_{3}$ (person).
column3: Also: $x_2$ is called $x_1$ by $x_3$ (= selcme for reordered places).  See also cmavo list {me'e}, {gismu}, {tcita}, {valsi}, {judri}. Historically used to describe words in the Lojban morphological class allocated for use with proper nouns; this sense has been deprecated in favor of {cmevla}.

column2: $x_{1}$ laughs (emotional expression).
$x_{1}$ is a member/element of set $x_{2}$; $x_{1}$ belongs to group $x_{2}$; $x_{1}$ is amid/among/amongst group $x_{2}$.
column3: $x_1$ may be a complete or incomplete list of members; $x_2$ is normally marked by la'i/le'i/lo'i, defining the set in terms of its common property(ies), though it may be a complete enumeration of the membership.  See also {ciste}, {porsi}, {jbini}, {girzu}, {gunma}, {klesi}, cmavo list {mei}, {kampu}, {lanzu}, {liste}.

column2: $x_{1}$ utters moan/groan/howl/scream [non-linguistic utterance] $x_{2}$ expressing $x_{3}$ (property).
column3: Also shriek, most animal sounds, e.g. bark, cackle, meow, neigh, moo, honk, baa, crow. See also {krixa}, {bacru}, {cusku}, {cortu}.

column2: $x_{1}$ [value] is a norm/average in property/amount $x_{2}$ (ka/ni) among $x_{3}$(s) (set) by standard $x_{4}$.
column3: Also mean, normal, usual; ($x_3$ specifies the complete set).  See also {tcaci}, {fadni}, {kampu}, {lakne}, {tarti}, {rirci}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a/the neck [body-part] of $x_{2}$; [metaphor: a relatively narrow point].
$x_{1}$ (agent) rewards $x_{2}$ [recipient] for atypical $x_{3}$ (event/property) with reward/desserts $x_{4}$.
column3: Differs from earned payment because of atypical nature; rewards need not be positive but are in some sense deserved from the point of view of the rewarder: positive reward (= {zanyne'u}), punishment, penalty, demerit (= {malne'u}, {sfane'u}); $x_4$ may be a specific object, a commodity (mass), an event, or a property; pedantically, for objects/commodities, this is sumti-raising from ownership of the object/commodity (= {posne'u}, {posyvelne'u} for unambiguous semantics).  See also {dunda}, {friti}, {jerna}, {jinga}, {jivna}, {pleji}, {sfasa}, {venfu}, {prali}, {dapma}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is orderly/neat/ordered in property/quantity $x_{2}$ (ka/ni).
$x_{1}$ is new/unfamiliar/novel to observer $x_{2}$ in feature $x_{3}$ (ka) by standard $x_{4}$; $x_{1}$ is a novelty.
$x_{1}$ is a quantity of/contains/is made of lead (Pb); [metaphor: heavy, malleable, soft metal].
$x_{1}$ is directly/vertically beneath/below/under/underneath/down from $x_{2}$ in frame of reference $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ soaks up/absorbs/sucks up $x_{2}$ from $x_{3}$ into $x_{4}$; $x_{1}$ is an absorbant.
$x_{1}$ is deep in extent in direction/property $x_{2}$ away from reference point $x_{3}$ by standard $x_{4}$.
$x_{1}$ hurts/feels pain/hurt at locus $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ gets/procures/acquires/obtains/accepts $x_{2}$ from source $x_{3}$ [previous possessor not implied].
column3: Also fetch; accept a gift (= {seldu'acpa}).  See also {punji}, {lebna}, {vimcu}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is upon/atop/resting on/lying on [the upper surface of] $x_{2}$ in frame of reference/gravity $x_{3}$.
column3: ($x_1$ may be object or event); See also se {vasru}, {jbini}, {zvati}, {nenri}, {vreta}, {ckana}, {diklo}, {jibni}, {lamji}, {zutse}, {punji} for lay upon, {sarji}, {zbepi}.

column2: $x_{1}$ climbs/clambers/creeps/crawls on surface $x_{2}$ in direction $x_{3}$ using $x_{4}$ [limbs/tools].
$x_{1}$ requests/asks/petitions/solicits for $x_{2}$ of/from $x_{3}$ in manner/form $x_{4}$.
column3: Also demand (= {mi'ecpe}); $x_4$ is a means of expression See also ve {cusku}.: a request may be indicated in speech, in writing, or by an action (e.g. petitions are often in writing, while begging/panhandling may be indicated by an action or even demeanor).  (cf. {pikci}, te {preti}, te {frati}, se {spuda}, {danfu})

column2: $x_{1}$ is pungent/piquant/peppery/spicy/irritating to sense $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ broadcasts/transmits [using radio waves] $x_{2}$ via station/frequency $x_{3}$ to [radio] receiver $x_{4}$.
column3: Also $x_1$ is a broadcaster.  See also {tivni}, {benji}, {tcana}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is anterior/ahead/forward/(in/on) the front of $x_{2}$ which faces/in-frame-of-reference $x_{3}$.
column3: Also: $x_3$ is the standard of orientation for $x_2$. See also {sefta}, {flira}, {trixe}, {mlana}, {pritu}, {zunle}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a shirt/blouse/top [upper-body garment - not necessarily sleeved or buttoned], material $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ (agent) harvests/reaps/gathers crop/product/objects $x_{2}$ from source/area $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a bear/ursoid of species/breed $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a fairy/elf/gnome/brownie/pixie/goblin/kobold [mythical humanoid] of mythos/religion $x_{2}$.
column3: Also orc, giant, demon or devil (when humanoid-form is presumed by the mythos/religion), bugbear, bogeyman.  (cf. {ranmi}, especially for non-humanoid creatures of myth, {lijda})

column2: $x_{1}$ is green/verdant [color adjective].
$x_{1}$ is a bridge/span over/across $x_{2}$ between $x_{3}$ and $x_{4}$ [unordered, typically destination first].
$x_{1}$ is summer/summertime [hot season] of year $x_{2}$ at location $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is autumn/fall [harvest/cooling season] of year $x_{2}$ at location $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a tide [cyclical/periodic expansion] in $x_{2}$ caused by $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a/the lip [body-part]/rim of orifice $x_{2}$ of body $x_{3}$; (adjective:) $x_{1}$ is labial.
$x_{1}$ is a tax/levy/duty on goods/services/event $x_{2}$ levied against $x_{3}$ by authority/collector $x_{4}$.
column3: Also custom, toll, tariff, tribute. See also {pleji}, {flalu}, {turni}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a quantity of petroleum/oil from source $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a shadow/the shade of object $x_{2}$, made by light/energy source $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ teaches audience $x_{2}$ ideas/methods/lore $x_{3}$ (du'u) about subject(s) $x_{4}$ by method $x_{5}$ (event).
column3: Also instruct, instructor, educate, educator, teacher, professor, pedagogue; (adjective:) $x_1$/$x_5$ is pedagogical.  See also {ckule}, {cilre}, {tadni}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is round/circular [2-dimensional shape/form]; $x_{1}$ is a disk/circle/ring.
column3: Normally used for a filled-in circle/disk, but emphasis on roundness means that the concept may include 'ring'.  See also {djine}, {ranji}, {bolci}, {tarmi}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a book containing work $x_{2}$ by author $x_{3}$ for audience $x_{4}$ preserved in medium $x_{5}$.
column3: $x_1$ is a copy/manifestation/container (a physical object or its analogue) of a literary work [$x_2$], not necessarily using paper (= {selpapri}). See also {cfika}, {prina}, {prosa}, {tcidu}, {papri}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is full/completely filled with $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ (event/state/property) is possible under conditions $x_{2}$; $x_{1}$ may/might occur; $x_{1}$ is a maybe.
$x_{1}$ is humble/modest about $x_{2}$ (abstraction); $x_{1}$ displays humility about $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a quantity of millet [grain] of species/strain $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is random/fortuitous/unpredictable under conditions $x_{2}$, with probability distribution $x_{3}$.
column3: Also accidental, chancy, by chance, adventitious, arbitrary (also = {cuncu'a}, {cunselcu'a}, {cunjdi}, {cunseljdi}; based on "unpredictable").  See also {cnici}, {lakne}, {funca}, {kalsa}, {snuti}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is an affair/organized activity involving person(s) $x_{2}$ (ind./mass); $x_{1}$ is $x_{2}$'s business.
column3: Also matter, concern; $x_2$ is engaged in $x_1$ (which is usually an abstraction) (= {selcu'u} for reordered places). See also {jikca}, {srana}.

column2: $x_{1}$ produces $x_{2}$ [product] by process $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ (agent) lets/permits/allows $x_{2}$ (event) under conditions $x_{3}$; $x_{1}$ grants privilege $x_{2}$.
column3: Sufficient condition (= {crutcini}), agent that permits a situation (= {tcinycru}).  See also {rinju}, {banzu}, {ralte}, {jimte}, {jaspu}, {zifre}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a worm/invertebrate animal of species/breed $x_{2}$.
column3: Also mollusk, snail (= {cakcurnu}), shellfish (= {xaskemcakcurnu}, {xaskemcakydja}); the generalization to invertebrate is because many multicellular invertebrates are indeed wormlike.  See also {since}, {silka}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is pure/unadulterated/unmitigated/simple in property $x_{2}$ (ka).
$x_{1}$ (agent) expresses/says $x_{2}$ (sedu'u/text/lu'e concept) for audience $x_{3}$ via expressive medium $x_{4}$.
column3: Also says.  See also {bacru}, {tavla}, {casnu}, {spuda}, cmavo list {cu'u}, {bangu}, {dapma}, {jufra}, {pinka}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a shoe/boot/sandal for covering/protecting [feet/hooves] $x_{2}$, and of material $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a/the chest/thorax/upper trunk/[rib cage/breast] [body-part] of $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ chooses/selects $x_{2}$ [choice] from set/sequence of alternatives $x_{3}$ (complete set).
$x_{1}$ fights/combats/struggles with $x_{2}$ over issue $x_{3}$ (abstract); $x_{1}$ is a fighter/combatant.
column3: Use $x_3$ tu'a for fight over an object/objective.  See also {bradi}, {gunta}, {talsa}, {darlu}, {fapro}, {jamna}, {sonci}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a drum/cymbal/gong [percussion musical instrument] with beater/actuator $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ hangs/dangles/is suspended from $x_{2}$ by/at/with joint $x_{3}$.
column3: Pendant (= {dadja'i}); also dependent (original meaning). See also {lasna}, {jorne}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is the answer/response/solution/[reply] to question/problem $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is an animal/creature of species $x_{2}$; $x_{1}$ is biologically animate.
$x_{1}$ is made of/contains/is a quantity of smoke/smog/air pollution from source $x_{2}$.
column3: $x_2$ may be a fire.  See also {pulce}, {gapci}, {sigja}, {bumru}.

column2: $x_{1}$ (force) puts pressure on/presses/applies force to $x_{2}$.
$x_1$ is the date [day,{week},{month},year] of event/state $x_2$, at location $x_3$, by calendar $x_4$.
column3: Time units in x1 are specified as numbers separated by pi'e, starting from the smallest time unit, or are unit values massified with joi. Alternatively, the time units in x1 are specified as numbers prefixed by {ny} for years, {ly} for months, {dy} for days, {cy} for hours, {my} for minutes, and {sy} for seconds, and in this scheme, any time unit may be left out. Cf. {de'i}, {djedi}, {jeftu}, {masti}, {nanca}, {tcika}.

column2: $x_{1}$ (event) interrupts/stops/halts/[disrupts] $x_{2}$ (object/event/process) due to quality $x_{3}$.
logical connective: sumti afterthought or.

attitudinal: 
{a'a} - attentive
{a'acu'i} - inattentive
{a'anai} - avoiding.

attitudinal: 
{a'a } - attentive
{a'a cu'i} - inattentive
{a'a nai} - avoiding.

attitudinal: 
{a'a } - attentive
{a'a cu'i} - inattentive
{a'a nai} - avoiding.
$x_{1}$ reflects French/Gallic culture/nationality/language in aspect $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ reacts/responds/answers with action $x_{2}$ to stimulus $x_{3}$ under conditions $x_{4}$; $x_{1}$ is responsive.
column3: $x_3$ stimulates $x_1$ into reaction $x_2$, $x_3$ stimulates reaction $x_2$ (= {terfra} for place reordering); attempt to stimulate, prod (= {terfratoi}, {tunterfratoi}).  See also {preti}, {danfu}, {spuda}, {cpedu}, {tarti}.

column2: $x_{1}$ forgives $x_{2}$ for event/state/activity $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ differs/is distinct from/contrasts with/is unlike $x_{2}$ in property/dimension/quantity $x_{3}$.
column3: Also other-than (less common meaning).  See also {ranxi}, {drata}, {dunli}, {simsa}, {vrici}.

column2: $x_{1}$ reflects African culture/nationality/geography in aspect $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ (action) is easy/simple/facile for $x_{2}$ (agent) under conditions $x_{3}$; $x_{2}$ does $x_{1}$ freely/easily.
$x_{1}$ is a fraction, with numerator $x_{2}$, denominator $x_{3}$ ($x_{2}$/$x_{3}$).
$x_{1}$ offers/proffers $x_{2}$ [offering] to $x_{3}$ with conditions $x_{4}$.
column3: ($x_4$ may be nu canja, nu pleji, etc.; an unconditional offering has the 'condition' of acceptance); $x_2$ may be a specific object, a commodity (mass), an event, or a property; pedantically, for objects/commodities, this is sumti-raising from ownership of the object/commodity (= {posfriti}, {posyselfriti} for unambiguous semantics).  See also {canja}, {dunda}, {rinsa}, {vecnu}, {jdima}, {cnemu}, {pleji}, {vitke}.

column2: $x_{1}$ frowns/grimaces (facial expression).
column3: $x_1$ frowns/grimaces at/in reaction to $x_2$ (= {frufra}).  See also {cmila}, {cisma}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a copy/replica/duplicate/clone of $x_{2}$ in form/medium $x_{3}$ made by method $x_{4}$ (event).
$x_{1}$ is a hook/crook [shape/form] of material $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a dog/canine/[bitch] of species/breed $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is the grammar/rules/defining form of language $x_{2}$ for structure/text $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a mitten/glove [hand and lower arm garment] of material $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is $10^{-24}$ of $x_{2}$ in dimension/aspect $x_{3}$ (default is units).
$x_{1}$ is $10^{24}$ of $x_{2}$ in dimension/aspect $x_{3}$ (default is units).
$x_{1}$ [magnitude] is a unit/degree of/on scale/reference standard $x_{2}$ (si'o) measuring property $x_{3}$.
column3: Also grade, level, point; $x_3$ dimension.  See also {ckilu}, {kantu}, {kelvo}, {merli}, {ranti}, {selci}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is $x_{2}$ gram(s) [metric unit] in mass (default is 1) by standard $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a rod/pole/staff/stick/cane [shape/form] of material $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a quantity of/is made of/contains grease/fat/oil from source $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a frame/structure/skeleton/outline supporting/load-bearing/determining the form of $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is gray [color adjective].
$x_{1}$ is a fruit [body-part] of species $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is public/un-hidden/open/jointly available to/owned by all among community $x_{2}$ (mass).
$x_{1}$ is the country of peoples $x_{2}$ with land/territory $x_{3}$; (people/territory relationship).
column3: Also sovereignty, domestic (as opposed to foreign), nation (when not referring to ethos).  See also {turni}, {natmi}, {jecta}, {tumla}, {tutra}, {lanci}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is industry/industrial/systematic manufacturing activity producing $x_{2}$ by process/means $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ [person] labors/works on/at $x_{2}$ [activity] with goal/objective $x_{3}$.
column3: Also: $x_1$ is a worker/laborer.  (cf. {sazri}, {gasnu}, {se} {jibri}; {zukte} - which need not be labor; physics term 'work' = {ni} {muvyselbai}, {briju}, {jibri}, {lazni}, {selfu})

column2: $x_{1}$ is a mass/team/aggregate/whole, together composed of components $x_{2}$, considered jointly.
column3: A description in $x_1$ indicates of mass property(ies) displayed by the mass; masses may reveal properties not found in the individual set members that are massified, which themselves are not necessarily relevant to the mass property implicit in this bridi.  See also {bende}, {girzu}, {pagbu}, cmavo list {loi}, {lei}, {lai}, {ciste}, {cmima}, {kansa}, {tinci}, {mulgunma}.

column2: $x_{1}$ rolls/trundles on/against surface $x_{2}$ rotating on axis/axle $x_{3}$; $x_{1}$ is a roller.
$x_{1}$ is a goose/[gander] of species/breed $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ (person/mass) attacks/invades/commits aggression upon victim $x_{2}$ with goal/objective $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is grain/[British: corn]/cereal from plant/species $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ blade/scraper/erosive scrapes/erodes/abrades $x_{2}$ from $x_{3}$.
$x_1$ [energy] is light/illumination illuminating $x_2$ from light source $x_3$.
column3: [$x_3$ illuminates/lights $x_2$ with light/illumination $x_1$; $x_2$ is lit/illuminated by illumination $x_1$ from source $x_3$ (= {selgu'i} for reordered places); light/lamp (= {tergu'i})](cf. {dirce}, {manku}, {solri}, {carmi}, {ctino}, {kantu})

column2: $x_{1}$ is a restaurant/cafe/diner serving type-of-food $x_{2}$ to audience $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is $x_{2}$ (default 1) short local distance unit(s) [non-metric], standard $x_{3}$, $x_{4}$ subunits.
column3: Foot (= {jmagutci}); yard (= {cibjmagutci}), pace (= {tapygutci}), inch (= {degygutci}), cubit (= {birgutci}).  (additional subunit places may be added as $x_5$, $x_6$, ...); See also {mitre}, {clani}, {ganra}, {condi}, {rotsu}, {rupnu}, {fepni}, {dekpu}, {minli}, {merli}, {bunda}, {kramu}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a/the womb/uterus [body-part] of $x_{2}$; [metaphor: nourishing, protective, giving birth].
$x_{1}$ is a melon/squash [fruit/plant] of species/strain $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a rule prescribing/mandating/requiring $x_{2}$ (event/state) within system/community $x_{3}$.
column3: Regulation, prescription (also $x_2$), principle, requirement (also $x_2$), prescribe, require (conditions are usually contained within $x_2$); $x_1$ is regulatory; $x_2$, $x_3$ are regulated.  See also {flalu}, {ritli}, cmavo list {ja'i}, {marde}, {tcaci}, {tinbe}, {zekri}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a bomb/explosive device with explosive material/principle $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a berry (fruit/plant) of plant/species $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is born to $x_{2}$ at time $x_{3}$ [birthday] and place $x_{4}$ [birthplace]; $x_{1}$ is native to (fo) $x_{4}$.
column3: $x_2$ bears/gives birth to $x_1$; also $x_3$: natal day.  See also {fange}, {gutra}, {rorci}, {mamta}, {salci}, {citsi}.

column2: $x_{1}$ (agent) borrows/temporarily takes/assumes $x_{2}$ (object) from source $x_{3}$ for interval $x_{4}$.
column3: Credit (= {jernu'e}); borrow/assume a property or quality as a chameleon does (= {zaskai}, {zasysmitra}, {zasysmitai}).  See also {dejni}, {janta}, {zivle}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is between/among set of points/bounds/limits $x_{2}$ (set)/amidst mass $x_{2}$ in property $x_{3}$ (ka).
column3: $x_2$ (a complete set, generally ordered) defines the bounds/limits/range for $x_1$.  See also se {vasru}, {nenri}, {zvati}, {cpana}, {snuji}, {senta}, {bitmu}, {jimte}, {kuspe}, {jibni}, {lamji}, {sruri}, {vanbi}, {midju}, {cmima}, {setca}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is firm/hard/resistant/unyielding to force $x_{2}$ under conditions $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ (person) decides/makes decision $x_{2}$ (du'u) about matter $x_{3}$ (event/state).
$x_{1}$ (experiencer) decreases/contracts/is reduced/diminished in property/quantity $x_{2}$ by amount $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ [amount] is the price of $x_{2}$ to purchaser/consumer $x_{3}$ set by vendor $x_{4}$.
column3: $x_2$ may be a specific object, a commodity (mass), an event, or a property; pedantically, for objects/commodities, this is sumti-raising from ownership of the object/commodity (= {posydi'a}, {posyseldi'a} for unambiguous semantics); price is something decided/set by the seller, and is closely akin to offer ({friti}), which is what a buyer may decide; (note that price is not he same as cost/expense, which is the actual amount exchanged in a transaction; the latter is {vecnu} or {canja}; neither is the same as "value" or {vamji}; in colloquial English, these are sometimes interchanged, at least partially because of the rarity of barter and bargaining in the marketplace).  See also {canja}, {friti}, {janta}, {jdini}, {kargu}, {pleji}, {dapma}, {vamji} for 'value', ve {vecnu} for 'cost', {canja}, {fepni}, {jerna}, {jinga}, {prali}, {rupnu}, {sfasa}, {vamji}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is money/currency issued by $x_{2}$; (adjective:) $x_{1}$ is financial/monetary/pecuniary/fiscal.
column3: 'currency' sometimes is restricted to paper money (= {pledi'i}).  See also {fepni}, {jdima}, {rupnu}, {sicni}, {canja}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a quantity of jelly/semisolid [texture] of material/composition including $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ pertains to the common Judeo-Christian-Moslem (Abrahamic) culture/religion/nationality in aspect $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ burns/[ignites/is flammable/inflammable] at temperature $x_{2}$ in atmosphere $x_{3}$.
column3: Default $x_2$/$x_3$ to normal temperatures in air; ignite (= {jelcfa}), flammable/inflammable (usually = {jelka'e} or {jelfrili}).  See also {fagri}, {kijno}, {sigja}, {livla}, {sacki}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a gem/polished stone/pearl of type $x_{2}$ from gemstone/material/source $x_{3}$.
column3: Also jewel (= {jmeja'i}); gemstone (= $x_2$, $x_3$, or {jmero'i}, {jmekunra}); pearl (= {selcakyjme} - a gem found inside a shell, {tercakyjme} - a gem made of shell material, {boijme} - any ball-shaped gem), mother-of-pearl (= {cakyjme}).  See also {kunra}, {rokci}, {jadni}, {dirba}, {kargu}, {krili}, {pulji}.

column2: $x_{1}$ (event) shocks/stuns $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is an axle/spindle [tool] on which $x_{2}$ rotates, of material/properties $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a/the claw/nail/talon [body-part] of $x_{2}$; [metaphor: pointed, penetrating, physical weapon].
$x_{1}$ is an angle [2-dimensional shape/form] from vertex $x_{2}$ subtended by lateral [segment] $x_{3}$.
column3: Also (adjective:) $x_1$ is angular; $x_2$ corner; (segment $x_3$ can be defined by interval).  See also {kojna}, {linji}, {konju}, {mokca}.

column2: $x_{1}$ grasps/holds/clutches/seizes/grips/[hugs] $x_{2}$ with $x_{3}$ (part of $x_{1}$) at locus $x_{4}$ (part of $x_{2}$).
column3: Hug (= {birjai}, {pamjai}); handshake (= {xanjaisi'u}); hold with hands (= {xanjai}); handle (= {jaitci}).  See also {ralte}, {pencu}, {darxi}, {batke}, {rinju}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a knot/tangle in/between $x_{2}$ (object/jo'u-objects).
column3: Knot (verb = {jgegau}, {jgezu'e}, {jgeri'a}, {jgela'a}), knot: fastening between two or more cords (= {jgeterjo'e}).  See also {pluja}, {julne}, {lasna}, {skori}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a gene of creature [or locus on creature] $x_{2}$ determining trait/process $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ (person) feels/has pride in/about $x_{2}$ (abstraction).
column3: An emotional combination of satisfaction and respect/esteem towards property(ies) or action(s) of person/entity that has a specific tie to emoter; self-pride (= {se'ijgi}, {tolcumla}); use $x_2$ tu'a for pride in non-specific actions/properties of someone.  See also {cinmo}, {cumla}, {sevzi}, {sinma}, {snada}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is guitar/violin/fiddle/harp [stringed musical instrument] with actuator/plectrum/bow $x_{2}$.
column3: Also lute, viola, cello.  See also {zgike}.

column2: $x_{1}$ (person) intuits $x_{2}$ (du'u) about subject $x_{3}$; [epistemology].
column3: Words usable for epistemology typically have a du'u place.  See also {djuno}, {facki}, {jimpe}, {jinvi}, {nabmi}, {pensi}, {sidbo}, {smadi}.

column2: $x_{1}$ interacts/behaves socially with $x_{2}$; $x_{1}$ socializes with/is sociable towards $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is made of/contains/is a quantity of liquor/spirits distilled from $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a quantity of/contains/is made of alkali/base of composition including $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ (person) is jealous of/envies $x_{2}$ (person) about/for $x_{3}$ (property - ka).
$x_{1}$ is a branch/bough/limb of $x_{2}$; $x_{2}$ forks into branches $x_{1}$; [preferred over metaphorical birka].
$x_{1}$ understands/comprehends fact/truth $x_{2}$ (du'u) about subject $x_{3}$; $x_{1}$ understands (fi) $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a limit/extreme/bound/border/[confinement] of $x_{2}$ in property/domain $x_{3}$.
column3: Restrain/constrain within limits (= {jitri'u}, {jitygau}, {jityzu'e}).  See also cmavo list {ji'e}, {traji}, {korbi}, {kuspe}, {rinju}, {bapli}, {curmi}, {fanta}, {jbini}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a pair of shears/scissors for cutting $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ (person/team) wins/gains prize $x_{2}$ from/over $x_{3}$ [competitors/losers] in competition $x_{4}$.
column3: Also: $x_1$ is a victor; $x_2$ reward; $x_3$ competitors here are opponents and in many situations, defeated/losers, vs. the set of those competing for a goal; $x_2$ may be a specific object, a commodity (mass), an event, or a property; pedantically, for objects/commodities, this is sumti-raising from ownership of the object/commodity (= {posyji'a}, {posyselji'a} for unambiguous semantics).   See also {cirko}, {jivna}, {talsa}, {cnemu}, {prali}, {pleji}, {sfasa}, {jdima}, {jerna}, {bradi}, {kargu}, {kelci}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a vaccine/immune-system stimulant protecting $x_{2}$ against disease $x_{3}$ introduced by method $x_{4}$.
$x_{1}$ is a quantity of/contains/is made of made of metal of composition including $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ (object/person) is immersed/submerged/bathes in liquid $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ (object) is clean/pure of material/contaminant/dirt $x_{2}$ by standard $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a well/spring of fluid $x_{2}$ at location $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ thinks/opines $x_{2}$ [opinion] (du'u) is true about subject/issue $x_{3}$ on grounds $x_{4}$.
column3: Words usable for epistemology typically have a du'u place. See also cmavo list {pe'i}, {djuno}, {krici}, {ciksi}, {jijnu}, {nabmi}, {pensi}, {senpi}, {sidbo}, {birti}, {pinka}.

column2: $x_{1}$ (property - ka) is an innate/inherent/intrinsic/natural property/quality/aspect of $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a chicken/[hen/cock/rooster]/small fowl [a type of bird] of species/breed $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a tip/point/vertex/extremity/end [0-dimension shape/form] on object $x_{2}$ at locus $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a/the horn [body-part] of $x_{2}$; [metaphor: pointed extremity].
$x_{1}$ is made of/contains/is a quantity of juice/nectar from-source/of-type $x_{2}$.
column3: Water-based extract from a (generally) biological source. See also {pinxe}, {djacu}, {grute}, {stagi}.

column2: $x_{1}$ (du'u) is false/is an untruth by standard/epistemology/metaphysics $x_{2}$.
column3: Words usable for epistemology typically have a du'u place.  See also {fatci}, {stace}, {jetnu}, {cfika}.

column2: $x_{1}$ has control over/harnesses/manages/directs/conducts $x_{2}$ in $x_{3}$ (activity/event/performance).
column3: $x_2$ are aspects/individuals controlled within activity/event $x_3$; manage (= {selzuktro}, {selzukfu'e}, {gu'etro}, {gunfu'e}, {xaktro}, {xakfu'e}) (as distinct from manager/boss = {gunterbe'e}, {gunja'a}, {gunmi'e}, {gunca'i}).  (cf. cmavo list {ji'o}, {bapli}, te {bende}, {gidva} - which does not necessarily control or command, {jatna}, {macnu}, {minde}, {ponse}, {ralju}, {rinka}, {sazri}, {turni}, {vlipa}, {xance}, {xlura})

column2: $x_{1}$ weaves $x_{2}$ from material/[yarn] $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ competes/vies with opponent $x_{2}$ in contest/competition $x_{3}$ (event) for gain $x_{4}$; $x_{1}$ rivals $x_{2}$.
column3: Also $x_2$ opponent(s), competitor(s), rival(s); $x_3$ competition, race; $x_4$ prize, reward, recognition (gain may be internal or external).  See also {cnemu}, {jinga}, {talsa}, {bradi}, {fapro}, {kelci}.

column2: $x_{1}$ (mass/jo'u) gathers/collects at location $x_{2}$ from locations $x_{3}$ (mass/jo'u).
$x_{1}$ is a shoal [shallow hazard]/reef of material $x_{2}$ in body of water $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ adds/combines $x_{2}$ to/with $x_{3}$, with result $x_{4}$; $x_{1}$ augments $x_{2}$ by amount $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ lives/is alive by standard $x_{2}$; $x_{1}$ is an organism/living thing.
$x_{1}$ (text) is a sentence/statement about $x_{2}$ [topic/subject/predicate/focus] in language $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a spider/arachnid/crustacean/crab/lobster/non-insect arthropod of species/breed $x_{2}$.
column3: Due to the unusual grouping of concepts in this definition, {ankabuta} is favored for "spider". See also {cinki}, {danlu}.

column2: $x_{1}$ cooks/prepares food-for-eating $x_{2}$ by recipe/method $x_{3}$ (process).
column3: Cook with heat (= {glajukpa}, {glaterjukpa}), bake (= {tokyjukpa}); fry (= {rasyjukpa}).  See also {cupra}, {bredi}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a net/filter allowing passage of $x_{2}$, prohibiting passage of $x_{3}$, netting properties $x_{4}$.
$x_{1}$ is attentive towards/attends/tends/pays attention to object/affair $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ reflects Chinese [Mandarin, Cantonese, Wu, etc.] culture/nationality/language in aspect $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is clock/watch/timer measuring time units $x_{2}$ to precision $x_{3}$ with timing mechanism/method $x_{4}$.
$x_{1}$ (person) is serious/earnest/has gravity about $x_{2}$ (event/state/activity).
$x_{1}$ is the weight of object $x_{2}$ in [gravitational or other force] field $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a bacterium/germ/microbe/protozoan/amoeba [1-celled life] of species/defining property $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ (event/action/state) is severe/harsh to $x_{2}$ [victim/experiencer].
$x_{1}$ is a cup/glass/tumbler/mug/vessel/[bowl] containing contents $x_{2}$, and of material $x_{3}$.
column3: A kabri is normally eaten from by lifting it; a palta is not.  See also {palta}, {citka}, {blaci}, {tansi}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a camera/photographic equipment recording illumination type $x_{2}$ images to medium $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ reflects Canadian culture/nationality in aspect $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ coughs/farts/burps up/out $x_{2}$ [predominantly gaseous] from orifice $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ [agent] plays with plaything/toy $x_{2}$.
column3: Play game (= {ci'erkei}), play competitively (= {jvikei}).  See also {jivna}, {jinga}, {zdile}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is $x_{2}$ degree(s) Kelvin [metric unit] in temperature (default is 1) by standard $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a cancer [malignant disease] in $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is outer space near/associated with celestial body/region $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a/the hair/fur [body-part] of $x_{2}$ at body location $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a/the ear [body-part] of $x_{2}$; [metaphor: sensory apparatus, information gathering].
$x_{1}$ reflects South American culture/nationality/geography in aspect $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a cavity/hole/hollow/cavern in $x_{2}$; $x_{1}$ is concave within $x_{2}$; $x_{2}$ is hollow at locus $x_{1}$.
column3: Also pit, depression, concavity; hollow (= {selke'a}).  See also {fenra}, {kunti}, {canlu}, {canko}, {galxe}, {tubnu}.

column2: $x_{1}$ feels comfort/is comfortable with conditions/environmental property(ies) $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is delicious/tasty/delightful to observer/sense $x_{2}$ [person, or sensory activity].
$x_{1}$ [mass of ideas, customs, skills, arts] is culture of nation/ethos $x_{2}$ (mass); $x_{1}$ is ethnic.
column3: (note that $x_2$ is NOT individual; culture is what is shared among people and is not an individual trait).  See also cmavo list {ka'u}, cmavo list {ku'u}, {natmi}, {cecmu}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a room of/in structure $x_{2}$ surrounded by partitions/walls/ceiling/floor $x_{3}$ (mass/jo'u).
$x_{1}$ is a camel/llama/alpaca/vicuna/dromedary of species/breed $x_{2}$.
column3: Llama (= {tcokumte}), Bactrian camel (= {zdokumte}); Arabian camel/dromedary (= {rabykumte}).  See also {sunla}, {kanla}, {xirma}, {xasli}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is/contains/is made from a mineral/ore of type/metal $x_{2}$ mined from location/lode/mine $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ [container] is empty/vacant of $x_{2}$ [material]; $x_{1}$ is hollow.
column3: Also vacuum (= kunti be roda/so'ada).  See also {culno}, {tisna}, {claxu}, {canlu}, {kevna}, {setca}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a right-angled shape/form defined by set of vertices $x_{2}$, dimensions $x_{3}$ (default 2).
column3: Also rectangle, square, rectilinear; square (= {kubykurfa}, {pitkubykurfa}), cube (= {kurkubli}), rectangle (= {clakurfa}), rhombus/diamond (= {sa'orkurfa}, {sa'orpitkubli}).  See also {bliku}, {kubli}, {tapla}, {salpo}, {tarmi}.

column2: $x_{1}$ takes-care-of/looks after/attends to/provides for/is caretaker for $x_{2}$ (object/event/person).
column3: Also tends, cares for, keeps; $x_1$ is a keeper/custodian of $x_2$.  See also {jundi}, {cinri}, {prami}, {raktu}, {zgana}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is bitter/acrid/sharply disagreeable to observer/sense $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ ranges/extends/spans/persists/reaches across/over interval/gap/area/scope/extent/range $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ (person) is cruel/mean/unkind to victim $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ analyzes/examines-in-detail $x_{2}$ by method/technique/system $x_{3}$ [process/activity].
$x_{1}$ is a sheep/[lamb/ewe/ram] of species/breed $x_{2}$ of flock $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a can/tightly sealed/pre-sealed container for perishable contents $x_{2}$, made of $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is in balance/equilibrium under forces $x_{2}$ (mass).
$x_{1}$ (mass) is a family with members including $x_{2}$ bonded/tied/joined according to standard $x_{3}$.
column3: Also clan, tribe; $x_2$ is in $x_1$, a member of $x_1$ ({selylanzu} for reordered places); relative (= {lazmi'u} - xy mintu y'y leka cmima da poi lanzu).  See also {natmi}, {cmima}, {girzu}, {jutsi}, {klesi}.

column2: $x_{1}$ (process) is an art [creative application] of craft/skill $x_{2}$ (idea/activity).
$x_{1}$ (person) is lazy/avoiding work/effort concerning action $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ takes/gets/gains/obtains/seizes/[removes] $x_{2}$ (object/property) from $x_{3}$ (possessor).
column3: Also confiscate, appropriate.  Acquire with volition such that $x_1$ gains possession; $x_3$ is possessor and not merely source, alienation is implied.  (cf. {punji}, {cpacu} where volition or previous possession is not necessarily implied, {vimcu} for alienation where $x_1$ need not gain possession, {canci}, {cliva})

column2: $x_{1}$ is a lens/glass [focussing shape/form] focussing $x_{2}$ to focus/foci $x_{3}$ by means/material $x_{4}$.
column3: (adjective:) $x_1$ is optical; focussing may be optical or otherwise, hence $x_2$ which may be light, sound, X-ray, etc., default is light/optical lens; ka is refraction. See also {kacma}, {minra}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is cold/cool by standard $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ (event) is late by standard $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ (la'e zo BY/word-bu) is a letter/digit/symbol in alphabet/character-set $x_{2}$ representing $x_{3}$.
column3: Also $x_1$ glyph, rune, character (also me'o BY/word-bu), $x_2$ symbol set; (adjective:) $x_1$ is alphabetic/symbolic; "letteral" used by analogy with "numeral"; sinxa is the more generic symbol.  See also {mifra}, {namcu}, {sinxa}, {pandi}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a line/among lines [1-dimensional shape/form] defined by set of points $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a length of chain/links of material $x_{2}$ with link properties $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is light in mass/weight by standard $x_{2}$.
$x_1$ is a story/tale/yarn/narrative about plot/subject/moral $x_2$ by storyteller $x_3$ to audience $x_4$.
column3: Also legend; a narrative need not be fictional; $x_2$ may be merely a convention rather than a subject; also $x_3$ tells/recounts story/tale $x_1$ about $x_2$ to $x_4$ (= {selterlisri} for place reordering); note that the storyteller need not be the author.  See also {ranmi}, {cfika}, {skicu}, {prosa}, {pemci}.

column2: $x_{1}$ (physical object) is a list/catalog/register of sequence/set $x_{2}$ in order $x_{3}$ in medium $x_{4}$.
column3: Also roll, log.  ($x_2$ is completely specified); (cf. {porsi}, {girzu}, {cmima} for mental objects wherein order is of varying importance; some manifested order is intrinsic to a physical list, but the specific order may be incidental and not intentional/purposeful)

column2: $x_{1}$ is $x_{2}$ liter(s) [metric unit] in volume (default is 1) by standard $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is liquid/fluid, of composition/material including $x_{2}$, under conditions $x_{3}$.
column3: Conditions include temperature and pressure.  See also {cilmo}, {djacu}, {lumci}, {runta}, {pambe}, {sudga}, {gapci}, {sligu}, {flecu}, {jduli}.

column2: $x_{1}$ travels/journeys/goes/moves via route $x_{2}$ using means/vehicle $x_{3}$; $x_{1}$ is a traveller.
column3: ($x_2$ as a set includes points at least sufficient to constrain the route relevantly); See also {bajra}, {cadzu}, {cpare}, {tcana}, {klama}, {cliva}, {pluta}, {limna}, {muvdu}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a/the liver [body-part] of $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a fuel/energy-source for powering $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ [rules/methods] is a logic for deducing/concluding/inferring/reasoning to/about $x_{2}$ (du'u).
$x_{1}$ is a temple/church/sanctuary/synagogue/shrine of religion $x_{2}$ at location/serving area $x_{3}$.
column3: $x_2$ may be event of form (... worships/pays/respect to ...), hence (metaphorically extending to) monument (= {mojmalsi}, {si'armalsi}).  See also {cevni}, {krici}, {lijda}, {ritli}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a mother of $x_{2}$; $x_{1}$ bears/mothers/acts maternally toward $x_{2}$; [not necessarily biological].
$x_{1}$ feels wonder/awe/marvels about $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ (object/event) is uniform/homogeneous in property $x_{2}$ (ka).
$x_{1}$ is dark/lacking in illumination.
$x_{1}$ is a frame of reference/standard for observing/measuring/determining $x_{2}$, with/by rules $x_{3}$.
column3: ($x_1$ may be object or si'o idea); See also cmavo list {ma'i}, {ckilu}, {merli}, {pajni}, {cimde}, {jdice}, {marde}.

column2: $x_{1}$ satisfies evaluator $x_{2}$ in property (ka)/state $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is an ant of species/breed $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a cap/hat/crown/helmet/piece of headgear [head-top garment] of material $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a quantity of/contains/is made of cotton [type of fabric/material].
$x_{1}$ fits/matches/suits/is compatible/appropriate/corresponds to/with $x_{2}$ in property/aspect $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a shelter/haven/refuge/retreat/harbor for/protecting $x_{2}$ from danger/threat $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a vehicle/mode of transport carrying $x_{2}$ in/on surface/medium $x_{3}$, propelled by $x_{4}$.
$x_{1}$ are the ethics/morals/moral standards/ethical standards of $x_{2}$ (ind./mass) about situation $x_{3}$.
column3: $x_1$ will (typically) be an abstract, a rule or rules of behavior; also principles; also conscience (= {sezmarde}).  See also {palci}, {vrude}, {lijda}, {manri}, {javni}, {tarti}, {zekri}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a quantity of/contains/made of mercury/quicksilver; [metaphor: fluid metal; temperature].
$x_{1}$ is material/stuff/matter of type/composition including $x_{2}$ in shape/form $x_{3}$.
column3: Also (adjective:) $x_1$ is physical (one sense)/material.  See also {morna}, {mucti}, {nejni}, {tarmi}, {dacti}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a quantity of hemp/marijuana/jute of species/strain $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ [force] mashes/crushes/squashes/smashes $x_{2}$ into pulp/mash/crumbs/deformed mass $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a quantity of/contains butter/oleo/margarine/shortening from source $x_{2}$.
column3: (adjective:) $x_1$ is buttery; an edible fat, solid but spreadable at normal temperatures; dairy butter (= {ladmatne}).  See also {grasu}, {kruji}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is beautiful/pleasant to $x_{2}$ in aspect $x_{3}$ (ka) by aesthetic standard $x_{4}$.
column3: Also handsome, pretty, gorgeous, cute, comely, graceful.  See also {pluka}, {xamgu}.

column2: $x_{1}$ reflects Malaysian/Malay culture/nationality/language in aspect $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a mind/intellect/psyche/mentality/[consciousness] of body $x_{2}$.
column3: (adjective:) $x_1$ is mental/psychological/a mental phenomenon; multiple personalities (= so'i {menli}).  See also {besna}, {morji}, {mucti}, {pensi}, {sanji}, {xanri}, {sevzi}, {xadni}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a sister of/sororal to $x_{2}$ by bond/tie/standard/parent(s) $x_{3}$; [not necessarily biological].
$x_{1}$ is $x_{2}$ minutes in duration (default is 1 minute) by standard $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ pertains to USA/American culture/nationality/dialect in aspect $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ (agent) measures/evaluates $x_{2}$ [quantity] as $x_{3}$ units on scale $x_{4}$ (si'o), with accuracy $x_{5}$.
$x_{1}$ reflects Mexican culture/nationality in aspect $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is in/at the middle/center/midpoint/[is a focus] of $x_{2}$; (adjective:) $x_{1}$ is central.
$x_{1}$ is encoded/cipher text of plain-text $x_{2}$ by code/coding system $x_{3}$; $x_{1}$ is in code; $x_{3}$ is a code.
$x_{1}$ doctors/treats/nurses/[cures]/is physician/midwife to $x_{2}$ for ailment $x_{3}$ by treatment/cure $x_{4}$.
column3: Also medic; (adjective:) $x_1$, $x_4$ is medical; $x_2$ is a patient of $x_1$ (= selmikce for reordered places) ; $x_2$ is treated by $x_1$ person/$x_4$ treatment/method; successfully cure transitive (= {sadmikce}, {sadvelmikce}), intransitive (= sadyselmikce, ka'orbi'o to not imply an external agent/process, though the $x_1$ and $x_4$ of mikce may be self/internal); treatment (= {velmikce}).  See also {bilma}, {kanro}, {spita}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a millionth [$10^{-6}$] of $x_{2}$ in dimension/aspect $x_{3}$ (default is units).
$x_{1}$ is a thousandth [1/1000; $10^{-3}$] of $x_{2}$ in dimension/aspect $x_{3}$ (default is units).
$x_{1}$ is mild/non-extreme/gentle/middling/somewhat in property $x_{2}$ (ka); $x_{1}$ is not very $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ issues commands/orders to $x_{2}$ for result $x_{3}$ (event/state) to happen; $x_{3}$ is commanded to occur.
column3: [also: $x_1$ orders/sets/Triggers. $x_2$ to do/bring about $x_3$; $x_1$ is a commander; commanded (= {termi'e})]; See also {lacri}, te {bende}, {jatna}, {ralju}, {jitro}, {turni}, {tinbe}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a machine for use/function $x_{2}$; [automated apparatus, without direct function control].
column3: Also machinery/mechanism; a machine is initiated/triggered by an agent/force, but thereafter performs its function automatically; if self-directed, (a minji is an) entity (= {zukte}).  See also {cabra}, {matra}, {tutci}, {zukte}, {pilno}, {skami}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is $x_{2}$ (default 1) long local distance unit(s) [non-metric], $x_{3}$ subunits, standard $x_{4}$.
column3: (additional subunit places may be added as $x_5$, $x_6$, ...); See also {mitre}, {kilto}, {clani}, {ganra}, {condi}, {rotsu}, {rupnu}, {fepni}, {dekpu}, {gutci}, {minli}, {merli}, {bunda}, {kramu}.

column2: $x_{1}$ reflects/mirrors/echoes $x_{2}$ [object/radiation] to observer/point $x_{3}$ as $x_{4}$; $x_{2}$ bounces on $x_{1}$.
column3: Also: $x_1$ is a mirror/reflector.  $x_2$ may be light, lu'e of an imaged object; $x_4$ may be image or echo or the same as $x_2$ if physical object; $x_3$ may be a path for a bounced object; ka is reflection.  See also {catlu}, {viska}, {lenjo}, {pensi}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is the same/identical thing as $x_{2}$ by standard $x_{3}$; ($x_{1}$ and $x_{2}$ interchangeable).
column3: (cf. {panra}, {satci}, {mapti}, {simsa}, {drata}, {dunli}, cmavo list {du} - which has no standard place, {simxu})

column2: $x_{1}$ keeps $x_{2}$ secret/hidden from $x_{3}$ by method $x_{4}$; $x_{2}$ is a secret; $x_{1}$ hides/conceals $x_{2}$.
column3: Intransitive hidden/secret, without an agent (= {selcri} or {nalterju'o}); secret (= {selmipri}).  See also {stace}, {mifra}, {sivni}, {djuno}, {cirko}, {jarco}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a deer/elk/moose/[hart/stag/doe] of species/breed $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ (person/object/event) is famous/renowned/is a celebrity among community of persons $x_{2}$ (mass).
column3: Also celebrated/well-known; (derogative meanings:) notorious/infamous (= {malmi'o}; these could also be expressed using the referenced words).  See also se {sinma}, {banli}.

column2: $x_{1}$ reflects Egyptian culture/nationality in aspect $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is $x_{2}$ meter(s) [metric unit] in length (default 1) measured in direction $x_{3}$ by standard $x_{4}$.
$x_{1}$ (mass) is a mixture/blend/colloid/commingling with ingredients including $x_{2}$.
column3: $x_2$ mingles/mixes/blends into $x_1$; $x_2$ is in $x_1$, an ingredient/part/component/element of $x_1$ (= {selxre} for reordered places).  See also {salta}, te {runta}, {stasu}, {jicla}, {sanso}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is to the side of/lateral to $x_{2}$ and facing $x_{3}$ from point of view/in-frame-of-reference $x_{4}$.
column3: (cf. {crane}, {trixe}, {pritu}, {zunle} which differ in that the direction of facing is the front and not the lateral side.  The $x_4$ of mlana may be either the front, or back side of $x_2$, {korbi})

column2: $x_{1}$ is a cat/[puss/pussy/kitten] [feline animal] of species/breed $x_{2}$; (adjective:) $x_{1}$ is feline.
$x_{1}$ is less than $x_{2}$ in property/quantity $x_{3}$ (ka/ni) by amount $x_{4}$.
column3: Also negative (= {nonme'a}).  See also cmavo list {me'a}, cmavo list {su'o}, {jdika}, {zmadu}, {traji}.
column8: me'a;se me'a;te me'a;ve me'a;se me'a nai

column2: $x_{1}$ is a mold/fungus/mushrooms/truffles of species/strain $x_{2}$ parasitic/growing on $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a satellite/moon orbiting $x_{2}$ with characteristics $x_{3}$, orbital parameters $x_{4}$.
attitudinal: \n{a'e} - alertness\n{a'enai} - exhaustion.
attitudinal: \n{a'o} - hope\n{a'onai} - despair.

attitudinal: 
{a'u} - interest
{a'ucu'i} - disinterest
{a'unai} - repulsion.

attitudinal: 
{au} - desire
{aucu'i} - indifference
{aunai} - reluctance.
tanru inversion operator; "... of type ..."; allows modifier trailing sumti without sumti links.
interval event contour: at the starting point of ...; initiative                   >|<    |.
elliptical/unspecified bridi relationship.
interval event contour: at the instantaneous point of ...; achievative/perfective; point event   >|<.
vocative: greetings/hello.
vocative: partings/good-bye.
interval event contour: at the ending point of ... even if not done; cessative      |  >< |.
elidable marker: separates selbri from preceding sumti, allows preceding terminator elision.
unary mathematical operator: absolute value/norm  |a|.
tense/modal question.
attitudinal: neutral scalar attitude modifier.
convert number to probability selbri; event $x_{1}$ has probability (n) of occurring under cond. $x_{2}$.
{cusku} modal, 1st place (attribution/quotation)    as said by source ...; used for quotation.
letteral for c.
logically quantified existential pro-sumti: there exists something 1 (usually restricted).
digit/number: all except n; all but n; default 1.
pro-sumti: a recent utterance.
logically quantified existential pro-sumti: there exists something 3 (usually restricted).
event contour for resumption of a paused process.
pro-sumti: the next utterance.
tense interval modifier: regularly; subjective tense/modal; defaults as time tense.
pro-sumti: he/she/it/they #10 (specified by goi).
sumti place tag: tag 5th sumti place.
reverse Polish mathematical expression (mex) operator flag.
begin indicator long scope.
attitudinal modifier: \n{fu'i} - easy\n{fu'inai} - difficult.
shift letterals to Greek alphabet.
elidable terminator: end GOI relative phrases; usually elidable in non-complex phrases.
logical connective: all but tanru-internal forethought connective medial marker.
logical connective: bridi-tail afterthought or.
logical connective: forethought all but tanru internal biconditional/iff/if-and-only-if(with gi).
pro-bridi: repeats a recent bridi (usually not the last 2).
pro-bridi: repeats the next to last bridi.
pro-bridi: preceding bridi; in answer to a yes/no question, repeats the claim, meaning yes.
sumti assignment; used to define/assign ko'a/fo'a series pro-sumti; Latin 'sive'.
column3: Note: Directionality of assignment may be ambiguous. {ca'e} on the "toward" side may be used to disambiguate.

column2: pro-bridi: repeats a future bridi, normally the next one.
pro-bridi: repeats a remote past bridi.
logical connective: forethought all but tanru-internal whether-or-not (with gi).
logical connective: tanru-internal forethought or (with gi).
logical connective: tanru-internal forethought and (with gi).
logical connective: tanru-internal forethought question (with gi).
logical connective: tanru-internal forethought biconditional/iff/if-and-only-if (with gi).
logical connective: tanru-internal forethought whether-or-not (with gi).
letteral for g.
sentence link/continuation; continuing sentences on same topic; normally elided for new speakers.
attitudinal: \n{i'a} - acceptance\n{i'anai} - blame.

attitudinal: 
{ia} - belief
{iacu'i} - skepticism
{ianai} - disbelief.
attitudinal: \n{i'o} - appreciation\n{i'onai} - envy.
attitudinal: \n{io} - respect\n{ionai} - disrespect.
logical connective: tanru-internal afterthought and.
scalar affirmer; denies scalar negation: Indeed!.
logical connective: tanru-internal afterthought conn question.
abstractor: truth-value abstractor; $x_{1}$ is truth value of [bridi] under epistemology $x_{2}$.
discursive: \n{je'u} - truth\n{je'unai} - falsity.
{jimte} modal, 1st place                            limitedly; up to limit ...
digit/number: approximately (default the typical value in this context) (number).
{jitro} modal, 1st place (control)                  controlledly; under direction of ...
{jicmu} modal, 1st place (assumptions);             given that ...; based on ...
logical connective: tanru-internal afterthought biconditional/iff/if-and-only-if.
discursive: metalinguistic affirmer.
non-logical connective: union of sets.
join mathematical expression (mex) operands into an array.
non-logical connective: mixed conjunction; "and" meaning "mixed together", forming a mass.

vocative: 
{ju'i} - attention
{ju'icu'i} - at ease
{ju'inai} - ignore me.

attitudinal modifier: 
{ju'o} - certainty
{ju'ocu'i} - uncertainty
{ju'onai} - impossibility.
letteral for j.
abstractor: property/quality abstractor (-ness); $x_{1}$ is quality/property exhibited by [bridi].
{klama} modal, 1st place                            gone to by ...
modal aspect: innate capability; possibly unrealized.
vocative: please repeat.
discursive: \n{ke'u} - repeating\n{ke'unai} - continuing.
tense/modal: set/use tense default; establishes new open scope space/time/modal reference base.
attitudinal question: confusion about something said.
elidable terminator: end mathematical (mex) forethought (Polish) expression; often elidable.
discursive: however/but/in contrast.
elidable terminator: end NOI relative clause; always elidable, but preferred in complex clauses.
{kulnu} modal, 1st place                            in culture ...
letteral for k.
name descriptor: the one(s) called ... ; takes name or selbri description.
discursive: \n{la'a} - probability\n{la'anai} - improbability.
delimited non-Lojban name; the resulting quote sumti is treated as a name.
2-word letteral/shift: punctuation mark or special symbol follows.
non-veridical descriptor: the one(s) described as ...
{klesi} modal, 1st place (scalar set)               in/of category ...
non-veridical descriptor: the stereotype of those described as ...
non-veridical descriptor: the set of those described as ..., treated as a set.
non-veridical descriptor: the mass of individual(s) described as ...

attitudinal modifier: 
{le'o} - aggressive
{le'ocu'i} - passive
{le'onai} - defensive.
end quote of questionable or out-of-context text; not elidable.
discursive: omitted text (quoted material).
elidable terminator: end grammatical quotation; seldom elidable except at end of text.
descriptor: the one, which (is / does) ... / those, which (are / do) ...
column3: Terminated with {ku}. Under the xorlo reform, {lo} converts a selbri to a sumti in a generic way. In particular, lo broda = {zo'e} noi broda.

column2: shift letterals to Lojban (Roman) alphabet.
veridical descriptor: the typical one(s) who really is(are) ...
veridical descriptor: the set of those that really are ..., treated as a set.
veridical descriptor: the mass of individual(s) that is(are) ...
convert letteral string or other mathematical expression (mex) operand to mex operator.
the mathematical expression (unevaluated); convert unevaluated mathematical expression to sumti.
elidable terminator: end sumti that was converted to selbri; usually elidable.
pro-sumti: me/we the speaker(s)/author(s); identified by self-vocative.
pro-sumti: me/we the speaker(s)/author(s) & others unspecified, but not you, the listener.
{mi'e} - self vocative: self-introduction; identifies speaker.\n{mi'enai} - denial of identity
non-logical interval connective: ordered components: ... center, ... range surrounding center.
pro-sumti: me/we the speaker(s)/author(s) & you the listener(s).
discursive: ditto.
pro-bridi: bridi/selbri/brivla question.
digit/number: too few; subjective.
convert sumti to mex operand; sample use in story arithmetic: [3 apples] + [3 apples] = what.
mark motions in space-time.
convert number to ordinal selbri; $x_{1}$ is (n)th member of set $x_{2}$ ordered by rule $x_{3}$.
{mukti} modal, 1st place                            because of motive ...
$x_1$ is a regular polyhedra/polygon/polytope with the Schläfli symbol {$x_2$, $x_3$, $x_4$, …}
column3: also "$x_1$ is a regular polytope". Polytope is a collective term for polygons, polyhedra and other dimentional shapes. "$x_1$ is a regular polytope with the Schläfli symbol $x_2$" is also valid if you want to use vectors. For Coxeter's extention, use a matrix. Cf. {kubli}

column2: $x_1$ is an axis/center curve/extended center (or, possibly metaphorically, focus 'point') of $x_2$ in sense $x_3$
column3: For figures of revolution, $x_3$ = "lo ka ce'u srana lo {jbislanu}". For rotation (in which mass is actually moving around it), $x_3$ = "lo ka ce'u se carna". For a political axis, $x_3$ would be filled with a reference to political importance or alliance. This word should probably not be used for coordinate systems (coordinate axes), but some construct involving {manri} might be apt for such an idea if used. The axis is the center of all considerations being made and is extended.

column2: $x_1$ is a mathematical set, containing members $x_2$

$x_1$ is meta to/an example of $x_2$ that describes such an object/concept/notion/system/topic/etc., being meta in property/aspect $x_3$, and which has features $x_4$, governed by/considered in system/considerations/epistemology/theory $x_5$; $x_1$ is meta (a particular type of abstraction of $x_2$ so as to apply to itself in some sense); $x_1$ is an/a piece of/an example of $x_2$ that applies fractally thereto
column3: Does not (necessarily) mean "beyond", "after", "beside"; in some (rather pictoral) senses, these meanings may be necessary but not sufficient for being meta in this sense; thus, "metaphysics" should not be translated using this word. x1 is an object, notion, topic, system, etc. which applies to x2 but which is itself an example thereof; for example, the meanings of the words "metalinguistics" and "metadata" are meta in this sense. It is not necessarily directly self-referential, but could be fractally applicative. x1 is an X that is about (another) X; x1 is an abstraction of X so as to apply to X. x1 does not necessarily abstract [from] (in one sense), but is abstract to, x2. See also: {xulta} (generalized/weaker), {sucta}.

column2: $x_1$ is a morphologically defined name word meaning $x_2$ in language $x_3$.
column3: (By analogy with {brivo}; syn. {cmevla}) In Lojban, such words are characterized by ending with a consonant. In Lojban, a {cmevo} may only consist of a single word, whereas a {cmene} can consist of one or multiple words, which may be cmevo. See also {vlaturge'a}.

column2: $x_1$ empathizes with $x_2$, showing same emotion $x_3$ about $x_4$
column3: A gismu for a very important concept that, for some reason, didn't find its way into the gimste. See {cinmo}, {dai}, {dunli}.

column2: $x_1$ is a plum/member of subgenus Prunus of genus Prunus of species/variety $x_2$
$x_1$ is functional / usable for function $x_2$

$x_1$ is a gesture/facial expression/body part motion/body language/expressive (nonverbal or nonvocal) feature/microexpression/stature/posture/sign/body signal [nonverbal expression made using only one's body parts and items on one's immediate person as extensions of the body in order to communicate; possibly nonlinguistic/extralinguistic] that conveys/expresses thought/emotion/command/idea $x_2$ (nu/si'o; possibly text and other types) made using body part/utensil/object/at locus $x_3$ in/by motion/action/means $x_4$
column3: Must be body-oriented; any other object involved is simply for the matter of convenience and acts as an extension of the body (and thus must be on the performer's immediate person at or near the locus of the gesture). Body language, posturing, and stature are usually considered to be nonlocalized (body-general), although they need not be (and technically are not in general). Must be externally visible and/or internally sensed. Any non-body-part utensil/item (including clothing) must function as an extension of the body in the gesture. Need not be conscious or performed by a person (note that agent/performer is not mentioned in this definition); can, but need not, be accompanied by vocalizations (not necessarily linguistic), but the gesture itself is not primarily noise-producing. Might include sign language words or cheremes, although a more explicit word for linguistically organized and “full” cheremes is preferred (and especially for the sign language as a whole). x1 is possibly best typed by {nu} and/or {si'o}. x4 might be best expressed as an event; for example, it could be "the event of the right hand touching the chest near the heart, with fist clenched" for a salute, whereas/wherein x3 would be merely the fist/hand (and the chest near the heart). Use "{cocygau}" resp. "{cocyzu'e}" for: "$x_1$ (agent resp. volitional entity) gestures; $x1$ agentively/actively makes gesture $x2$, communicating $x3$, performed with body part(s) $x4$ in motion $x5$"; this lujvo uses an unofficial cmarafsi. Proposed short rafsi: -coc-.

column2: $x_1$ appears
$x_1$ is a mythological/fantastic creature [mythical organism] of mythos/religion/story/culture $x_2$.
column3: Need not be an animal, nor even active, but must be alive/active/animate (includes ghosts, spirits, genies, golems, etc.). The reference set of this word is a strict superset of the reference set of "{crida}".  See also: "{ranmi}".
column5: mythological animal;mythological automaton;mythological fungus;mythological organism;mythological plant

column2: $x_1$ reflects/relates to/pertains to CLL (Lojbanic) grammatical standards in manner/aspect $x_2$, specific to version $x_3$ (contextless default: the most recent version that has been officially accepted by the Lojban language's governing body (presently, the BPFK))
$x_1$ is an arthropod; $x_1$ is a bug (broad sense)
column3: For a world in which {cinki} means "insect" or "hexapod". The source words for {cinki} mean "insect", so I prefer narrowing its meaning and adding a new word for "arthropod" based on more fitting source words. See also {lokra}, {jukni}, {sortu'e}

column2: $x_1$ (scalar-valued) is the norm/magnitude/size of concrete (and specific) mathematical object $x_2$ in norm space/according to metric (if relevant)/by definition/of type $x_3$
$x_1$ is the spacial interval/geodesic segment (or line segment/ray/line) from location/point $x_2$ to location/point $x_3$ in geometry/frame of reference $x_4$.
column3: Like "{temci}", but for space. "{nicfa}" yields a vector which encodes similar information (when projected into space). $x_4$ can be used, for example, in order to determine whether $x_1$ lies across the Earth's surface or cuts through the Earth (like a tunnel) for two distinct city centers. Like "temci", it is essentially just "{sirji}", but specifically designed in order to pertain to a given measurement-dimension (namely, in this case, space).

column2: $x_1$ deduces/reasons by deduction/establishes by deduction that $x_2$ is true about $x_3$ from general rule $x_4$

$x_1$ is aligned diagonally along/between nonadjacent vertices $x_2$ as in polytope $x_3$; $x_1$ is a diagonal line segment/linear manifold of lower dimension as viewed in frame of reference $x_3$; $x_1$ is crooked (one sense), skew (one sense, see notes), off-kilter (one sense), away from center/off-center, non-orthogonal/not perpendicular nor parallel, at an angle, perhaps non-vertical and non-horizontal, diagonal to $x_2$ in figure/coordinate system $x_3$.
column3: Not for use in: entries of tensors/matrices (confer: {daigno}), certain geometric meanings (such as with Cartesian products), etc.  Only for purely 'visual' geometric objects/figures/frames. The polytope in question need not actually be 'drawn'; an oriented frame of reference naturally 'projects' a polytopic sense onto all objects. x1 can be any linear manifold of lower dimension than the space in which it is embedded (defined by x3). The skewness is not relative to another linear manifold in some higher-dimensional space (the usual definition of "skew" in geometry) - it is simply a skewness (in a layperson sense) relative to points in a figure or axis in a coordinate system. Proposed by Gleki.

column2: $x_1$ is a gloss (brief explanatory note or translation) of $x_2$ (text)
$x_1$ is a gum/resin/glue of composition $x_2$; $x_1$ is gummy/chewy/glutinous
$x_1$ is the graph on vertices/nodes $x_2$ (set) and edges $x_3$ (set of ordered or unordered 2-tuples of vertices in $x_2$) and with additional properties $x_4$.
column3: A "web"/"network". An element of x2 is a "place" in a more generic/abstract/metaphoric sense than spatial; must be discrete. Thus, webpages, family diagrams, lattices, pages in a book, cities and roadways on a map, etc. constitute graphs. x1 also includes trees. Notice that both x2 and x3 are sets; a member of x3 is a 2-tuple, but the order matters iff x1 is oriented - in which case, the edge connects from the first node in the tuple to the second node in the tuple. x4 can include defining features, weights, etc. Equivalent to {grafetu} (which is merely the fu'ivla form of this word); very similar to {tcana}.

column2: $x_1$ pertains/is related to/reflects (the) gravitational interaction [fundamental]/gravity in manner/with properties/in state/with realization $x_2$, coupling to $x_3$ in manner/with strength $x_4$
$x_1$ is a mushroom of species $x_2$.
$x_1$ reflects jbobau language/culture/nationality/community in aspect $x_2$
column3: Alternative to {lojbo} based on the observation that the word "Lojban" has effectively become an exonym, as the majority of speakers now refer to Lojban as "lo/le/la jbobau" in the language itself. Especially used by speakers of nonstandard varieties of Lojban to distinguish dialects from the official standard of "CLL" Lojban.

column2: $x_1$ 'copies'/acknowledges/confirms of receipt and understanding of message/transmission/communication $x_2$ from sender/station $x_3$.
column3: Do you copy? = "xu do jenje"; "please copy" (command" = "(.e'o) ko jenje". See also: "{je'e}".

column2: $x_1$ has the opportunity to do/be $x_2$ (event/property) under conditions $x_3$; $x_1$ gets to do $x_2$
column3: Parallels {kakne}, but with emphasis on opportunity rather than potential. See also {prali}, {xamgu}, {zukte}. Proposed rafsi -jid-

column2: $x_{1}$ is a connective question, requesting the connective between $x_{2}$ (du'u) and $x_{3}$ (du'u) in that order, assuming that they are true.
column3: This word is to "{ji}" approzimately as "{kanxe}" is to "{je}". See also: {vlina}, {kanxe}, {tsida}, {ribga}.

column2: $x_1$ is a physical interaction [colloquially: force] between $x_2$ (interacting participants/objects; symmetric) with characteristics/of type $x_3$
column3: Not necessarily fundamental. Can include: forces ({forse}), pressures ({danre}), the fundamental interactions ({tsaba}, {dicma}, {vubla}, {grava}), the 'Higgs' mechanism ({xigzo}), etc. Direction (as of application) can be specified in $x_3$. See also {fisli}.

column2: $x_1$ consists of the economic system (production and distribution and consumption) of sector components $x_2$; $x_1$ is economic.
column3: x2 may be a country or other area, the labor, capital and land resources, and the economic agents that socially participate in the production, exchange, distribution, and consumption of goods and services of that area; they may be joined with JOI. {pavmomseljikni} for "primary sector", {relmomseljikni} for "secondary sector", {cibmomseljikni} for "tertiary sector", and {vonmomseljikni} for "quaternary sector"; {gubyseljikni} for "public/state sector", {sivyseljikni} for "private sector", and {jikseljikni} for "social/voluntary sector". Cf. {venci'e}, {selpraci'e}.

column2: $x_1$ pertains to politics/political affairs/political dynamics/interactions in system $x_2$, involving actors $x_3$ (set), and concerning topic $x_4$.
column3: This word focuses on the dynamic of social maneuvering or strategic interaction. It is general in that is is intended to handle any dynamic involving social strategizing and execution for the purpose of achieving some goal or gaining/maintaining power/authority. It happens in work places, in schools, in families - not just governing. For that specific sense, use a tanru or lujvo. See also: {trucu'u}, {jikca}.

column2: $x_1$ meets (encounters for the first time) $x_2$ under conditions $x_3$
column3: From Loglan "jmite". Refers to "meeting" in the sense of "first becoming acquainted with/introduced to." For the more literal sense of individuals encountering one another at a given location, see {penmi}.

column2: $x_1$ is the ISO designation/result/standard/code for topic $x_2$ applied to specific case/individual/group/thing $x_3$ according to rule/ISO specification $x_4$ published by/according to mandating organization $x_5$ (default: ISO)
column3: Theoretically, the standard organization/body could be other than ISO, but it should be prominent and/or international (and internationally recognized) in scope and nature; in such a case, replace each occurrence of "ISO" in the definition with the appropriate name/designation/title (of the organization, etc.). x1 need not be a name-designation/code (it could be the result of any rule), although it likely will commonly be so. Examples of possible x2-filling sumti: code-designations for language, country, currency, script, etc.. For an entity with a given code, use {terjviso} or {terseljviso} (specifying the type of entity being designated by use of the appropriate terbri j2); for a given ISO rule, consider {veljviso}; for the organization ISO, consider {xeljviso}. See also: {linga}, {landa}, {rucni}, {cilfu}, {jvinjiata}/{jvisiata}, {jvinjica'o}/{jvisica'o}, {jvisuai}, {jvisiupaco}, {jvisrcei}, {jvisrbipmo}. This word is the gismu version of: {javniso}/{jvaiso}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is $10^{(-30)}$ of $x_{2}$ in dimension/aspect $x_{3}$ (default is units).
$x_1$ is represents Celtic culture in aspect $x_2$
column3: Not necessarily confined to the British Isles. See also: {skoto}.

column2: $k_1$ is a quantity of cake/torte/tart/pie/flan made of/containing ingredients $k_2$, prepared according to method $k_3$.
$x_1$ (state/event/fact) is fair/just/righteous to $x_2$ according to $x_3$
column3: According to $x_3$, the way $x_2$ is treated in $x_1$ is just (it is "as things should be"). See also {pajni}, {sarxe}, {vrude}, {vudypai}, {nutli}, {pairnu'i}. (Many of those words deal with some judge acting "fairly" or "justly" in some matter, which kerni does not. In fact, a "to'e kerni" (unfair) situation is not necessarily the result of evil, may be considered unfair to all parties, and may be nobody's fault.)

column2: $x_1$ (property of $x_2$) is a stereotype of $x_2$ (object/set), held by $x_3$
column3: Does not necessarily carry a negative connotation. Stereotypes are, basically, the characteristics that come to one's mind when they imagine a particular object, regardless of actual commonality. e.g. Many people stereotypically think of roses as red, even though there are plenty of roses that aren't red. See {sei'i}, {lemkai}, {le'e}

column2: $x_{1}$ is $10^{30}$ of $x_{2}$ in dimension/aspect $x_{3}$ (default is units).

$x_1$ is orthogonal/perpendicular/right/at right angle/rectified/square/normal to $x_2$, where they (are projected to) intersect orthogonally at locus/on set $x_3$, otherwise being utterly distinct (and not even on the same axis/scale) in sense $x_4$
column3: This definition approximately parallels that of {panra}. For geometric orthogonality, fill $x_4$ with "geometry". This can be applied to lines, planes, curves, manifolds, vectors (endowed with inner product), etc. $x_1$ and $x_2$ are necessarily orthogonal at only $x_3$ (but may be elsewhere, such as if they are hyperplanes). $x_1$ and $x_2$ are symmetric terbri in this word under permutation. Also: "with negative reciprocal slope local to". This is a local property.

column2: $x_1$ (proposition) is data/information being an example of deep formalization of subject $x_2$ gathered by method $x_3$ (proposition)
$x_1$ is a lantern/flashlight/portable light source illuminating $x_2$, in style/with properties $x_3$
column3: Any small, portable light source designed to be carried; see {lamdu}, {fagri}, {gusni}.  It may be a garden decoration, so it may not even emit light, or light is metaphoric; see {jadni}.

column2: $l_1$ is an orchid of species/strain $l_2$
column3: a flower of the family Orchidaceae. see also {xrula} {latna} {rozgu} {lelxe} {tujli}

column2: $x_1$ is the home galaxy (default: Milky Way) of object/group/entity/race/vel sim. $x_2$.
$x_1$ is a lily [Lilium] of species/strain $x_2$
$x_1$ is a speakable language used by persons $x_2$
column3: A narrower term than {bangu}, is limited to speakable, usable in dialogues languages used by persons ({lo} {prenu}). Doesn't include languages with information transferred one-way (languages of road signs), doesn't include computer programming languages that are not speakable between two persons.

column2: $x_1$ is a quantity of slime/goop/goo of material/composition including $x_2$.
$x_1$ pertains to Loglan language/culture in aspect $x_2$
$x_1$ is mauve [color]
$x_1$ is a mango [fruit] of species/variety $x_2$.
column3: {rutrmango} is the non-experimental synonym of “mango”. {ricrmango} for “mango tree”.

column2: x1 is ten thousand [10000; $10^4$] of x2 in dimension/aspect x3
$x_1$ is a quantity of fluff of composition/structure/characterization/substance $x_2$; $x_1$ is fluffy/airy/soft/fuzzy in texture
column3: Visual and tactile. Most likely is malleable, but this word has no such implications inherently; porousness or foaminess is likewise not implied. Might also include "cushiony", "cotton-like", "wool-like"; a fractal nature might be present.  For fuzziness: not necessarily hairy or furry, but must be soft; not bristly (which implies stiffness and hardness).  See also: {ranti}, {rufsu}, {xutla}, {panje}, {dilnu}, {mapni}, {sunla}, {fonmo}, {jduli}, {pesxu}, {marji}.

column2: $x_1$ is a honey produced by $x_2$
$x_1$ is/are among the referent(s) of $x_2$
$x_1$ reflects Mesopotamian geography/chronology/culture/language/identity in aspect $x_2$
column3: This word could be applied to post-Islamic time periods, but it probably strongly connotes cultures and/or time periods of antiquity. See also: .{alcamacrike}, {lusto}, {bablo}, {sumro}, {xakto}, {semto}, {xrabo}.

column2: $x_1$ (bridi) is a metaphor/figurative expression having literal meaning $x_2$ to observer $x_3$
$x_1$ is localized public transport system for city/metropolitan region/locale/region $x_2$ using infrastructure/facilities/means of transportation $x_3$.
column3: This is mostly just to reserve the gismu space for "metro", which is begging to be made into a gismu; this may not be the best definition for the word space. Need not be a subway/underground train system.

column2: $x_1$ (li; number) is congruent to $x_2$ (li; number; see description for canonical/traditional/contextless default usage) modulo $x_3$ (li; number); $\frac{(x_1 - x_2)}{x_3}$ is an integer.
column3: In order to be clear (in case of poor display), ($x_1$ - $x_2$)/$x_3$ is an integer, possibly (but not necessarily) nonpositive. Traditionally, but not necessarily, $x_3$ is a strictly positive integer (in particular, $x_3$ is nonzero) and is called "(the) modulus"; if $x_3 = 1$, then $x_1$ and $x_2$ differ only by an integer amount - in other words, they have the same fractional part. Technically, $x_1$ and $x_2$ are symmetric under mutual exchange and can even be equivalent; however, in a manner morally analogous to "{srana}", $x_2$ is canonically/traditionally either the common residue (the unique element in the space which is congruent to $x_1$ mod $x_3$ and which is greater than or equal to 0 and strictly less than $x_3$) or the minimal residue (denoting the common residue by $c$, the minimal residue is either $c$ xor $c - x_3$, whichever is strictly less than the other in absolute value), and this may even be considered as its contextless default meaning (such as in "lo se modju"). See also: {dilcu}, {dunli}, {mintu}, {simsa}, {panra}, {dilma} (a particularly close relative and generalization of this word with slightly different focus). This word is essentially identical with {dilcrmadjulu}; consider this word to be its gismu equivalent. It is not the modulus operator; for that, use {veldilcu} or {vei'u}. It is a specific type of {terpanryziltolju'i}, although both occupy the word "modulo" in English. This word does not have direct access to "integer-part" but does to "fractional-part".

column2: $x_1$ is a blanket / quilt.
$k_1$ goes to bed from $k_3$.
$cl_1$ rises/gets up/leaves bed.
$x_1$ (text) is a commentary/annotation/exegesis about paragraph $x_2$ expressed by $x_3$ to audience $x_4$
$x_1$ says explanation $x_2$ (sedu'u/text) to $x_3$ via medium $x_4$, explaining $x_5$ (abstract)
$x_1$ is a sanitary pad/menstrual pad made of material $x_2$
$p_1$ is a diaper (absorbent garment) of material $p_2$.

$x_1$=$f_1$=$c_3$ authors/creates book $x_2$=$c_1$ about/containing work $x_3$=$c_2$ for audience $x_4$=$c_4$ preserved in medium $x_5$=$c_5$ for purpose $x_6$=$f_3$ from elements/ideas/inspiration $x_7$=$f_4$.
$k_1$ is a bookshelf attached to $k_2$.
$x_1$ is the $x_3$'rd edition of book/publication $x_2$ about subject/theme/story $x_4$ by author $x_5$ for audience $x_6$ preserved in medium $x_7$ .
$p_1$ is a chapter of book $c_1$=$p_2$.
column3: Indices, appendices and forwards are also ckupau. Cf. {ckupaupau}.

column2: $x_1$ is a part of $x_2$, which is a part of a book . $x_1$ is a part of chapter $x_2$
column3: $x_2$ is the name of the chapter, not the book. Cf. {ckupau}.

column2: $x_1$=$p_1$ is a series of books $x_2$=$c_1$=$p_3$.
$cup_1$ publishes $cup_2$=$cuk_1$ by process $cup_3$.
$s_1$ is a library of books $c_1$=$s_2$.
$z_1$ is a bookshop selling books $z_2$=$c_1$, operated by $z_3$.
$c_1$ is a librarian by standard $c_3$.
$s_1$ is library science with methodology $s_3$.
$k_1$=$b_1$ runs a marathon/long distance to destination $k_2$ from origin $k_3$ via route $k_4$.
$x1$=$c1$=$t1$ is a squeal/[long high-pitched sound] from source $x2$=$t3$
$x_1$=$ce_1$=$cl_1$ is a rifle for use against $x_2$ by $x_3$, launching projectile $c_2$ propelled by $c_3$.
$x_1$ is a long, thin, grainish cylinder (also known as spaghetti) of grain species $g_2$
column3: $x_1$ only refers to a single spaghetti. Consider using {lei} when talking of a bowl of spaghetti. See also {grusko}, {tamxri}, {grupu'o}.

column2: $co_1$ is a/the anterior (zootomy)/cranial/cephalic end (anatomy)/superior end (human anatomy) of body/object $cl_1$; $co_1$ (subevent) is at the starting point of long event/time-intervall $cl_1$.
column3: Metaphor: A tree grows in its long direction, with the roots as its starting point ({co'a}) and the crown as its ending point ({co'u}). Standard anatomical term to avoid ambiguity. In vertebrate usually the head, in invertebrate the end with a mouth (or equivalent structure), or the end that usually points in the direction of the organism's locomotion. See also anterior/superior absolute position ({claco'uklo}), anterior/superior relative position ({claco'umau}), posterior/inferior end ({claco'u}), anteroposterior (A-P) axis ({selcla}), ventral/anterior end ({befco'u}), dorsal/posterior end ({tolbefco'u}).

column2: $co_1$ is a/the anterior (zootomy)/cranial/cephalic end (anatomy)/superior end (human anatomy)/fore/bow (nautical)/nose (skateboard etc), of body/object $cl_1$; $co_1$ (subevent) is at the ending point of long event/time-intervall $cl_1$.
column3: Metaphor: A tree grows in its long direction, with the roots as its starting point ({co'a}) and the crown as its ending point ({co'u}). Standard anatomical term to avoid ambiguity, but not restricted to anatomical objects. In vertebrate usually the head, in invertebrate the end with a mouth (or equivalent structure), or the end that usually points in the direction of the organism's locomotion. In most animals the same as the front (={craraipau}), but in humans the same as the top (={gapraipau}). See also anterior/superior absolute position ({claco'uklo}), anterior/superior relative position ({claco'umau}), posterior/inferior end ({claco'a}), anteroposterior (A-P) axis ({selcla}), ventral/anterior end ({befco'u}), dorsal/posterior end ({tolbefco'u}/{bekpyco'u}).

column2: $co_1$=$d_1$ is/are anterior (zootomy)/cranial/cephalic (anatomy)/superior  (human anatomy) with frame-of-reference body/object $cl_1$=$d_3$.
