column3: Standard anatomical term to avoid ambiguity, but not restricted to anatomical objects. In most animals the same as the front (={craraipau}), but in humans the same as the top (={gapraipau}). See also anterior/superior end ({claco'u}), anterior/superior relative position ({claco'umau}), posterior/inferior end ({claco'a}), anteroposterior (A-P) axis ({selcla}), ventral/anterior end ({befco'u}), dorsal/posterior end ({tolbefco'u}/{bekpyco'u}).

column2: $co_1$=$z_1$ is/are anterior (zootomy)/cranial/cephalic (anatomy)/superior (human anatomy) to $z_2$ by margin $z_4$, in body/object $cl_1$=$d_3$.
column3: Standard anatomical term to avoid ambiguity, but not restricted to anatomical objects. In most animals the same as 'in front of' (={crane}), but in humans the same as 'above' (={gapru}). See also anterior/superior absolute position ({claco'uklo}), anterior/superior relative position ({claco'umau}), posterior/inferior end ({claco'a}), anteroposterior (A-P) axis ({selcla}), ventral/anterior end ({befco'u}), dorsal/posterior end ({tolbefco'u}/{bekpyco'u}).

column2: $x_1$ is a long knife
column3: This word is in Jbovlaste based on its use in CLL

column2: $xa_1$=$d_1$=$c_1$ is a sword / long knife weapon for use against $xa_2$=$d_2$ by $xa_3$ with blade of material $d_3$ long by standard $c_3$.
$d_1$=$g_1$=$c_1$ is a tower for purpose $d_2$.
$x1$=$g1$ lengthens $x2$=$c1$ in property/quantity $x3$ (ka/ni) by amount/excess $x4$
$t_1$ is a grape tomato of variety/strain $t_2$.
$k_1$=$c_1$ is a limousine for $k_2$, propelled by $k_3$.
$x_1$ (object/dimension) is shortest among set $x_2$ (set) in respective dimensions $x_3$ (default: the longest for each).
column3: Equivalent to "{toryrai}". Partially an .{u'ivla}, but with a little bit of philosophical underpinning: We should measure things by how much they have rather than how much they lack (good: how bright, how strong, how rich; bad: how dark, how weak, how poor) because 0 is the natural starting point and the quantity usually can be increased without upper bound. So, longness is a thing and shortness is a figment of our collective imagination, so to speak. So, "shortest" should really be "least long". Meanwhile, "{traji}" can accept either valence for extremeness, but defaults to the positive (id est: "most"), so we need to cajole it into the opposite ("least"). Thus, we get this long, gross word.

column2: $cr_1$=$k_2$ is an elf [long-eared mythical humanoid] of mythos/religion $cr_2$
$x_1$=$r_1$=$k_2$ is a hare of species $x_2$=$r_2$
$x_1$ is a fang.
$z_1$ is longer/taller than $z_2$ in direction $c_2$ by margin $z_4$.
$m_1$ is shorter than $m_2$ in direction $c_2$ by margin $m_4$.
$d_1$=$cl_1$=$cn_2$ is a giraffe of species/variety $d_2$.
$p_1$ feels longstanding love/strong affectionate devotion over a long time towards $p_2$.
$p_1$ is a leaf of $p_2$, long by standard $c_3$.
$p_1$ is a tall person, by measurement standard $c_3$.
$x_1$ (object/dimension) is longest among set $x_2$ (set) in respective dimensions $x_3$ (default: the longest for each).
$xa_2$=$c_1$ is tall in stature by measurement standard $c_3$.
column3: Cf. {clani}, {xadni}, {clapre}, {brabracrida}.  Refers specifically to a body.

column2: $s_1$ is a (garden) leek (Allium porrum/Allium ampeloprasum) of variety/strain $s_2$.
$t_1$ is a long time/duration/interval/period/elapsed time from time/event $t_2$ to time/event $t_3$.
$x_1$=$m_1$=$c_1$ measures $x_2$=$m_2$ meters in its longest direction $x_3$=$m_3$=$c_2$ by measurement standard $x_4$=$m_4$.
column3: x1 {clani} is not asserted, which is why clani3 is absent. Cf. {gantre}, {tsutre}.

column2: $x1$=$v1$=$c1$ sighs $x2$=$c2$ (text) to $x3$=$c3$
letteral: ellipsis mark (letteral).
$g_1$ is a cucumber of cultivar $g_2$.
$x_1$ is a cross-section of object $x_2$ which has an axis, such that the cross-section is made perpendicular to that axis (viewes along it), contains contents $x_3$, and is $x_4$-dimensional.
column3: $x_3$ determines which such cross-section is $x_1$. The veljvo are experimental gismu: "{clenu}", "{kukru}", "{paxra}".

column2: $x_1$ is a form of ornamentation arranged cylindrically and which is meant to be viewed so that its axis is collapsed to a point (in perpendicular cross-section), which adorns $x_2$
column3: Uses experimental gismu: {clenu}, {kukru}, {paxra}. This is opposed to tile/flat/two-dimensional art (such as paintings) and/or art which decorates an object and is meant to be viewed along the sides of that object in profile (such as on Greek urns, etc.).

column2: $x_1$=$n_1$=$c_1$ likes learning about $x_2$=$n_2$=$c_3$ from source $x_3$=$c_4$ by method $x_4$=$c_5$
$n_1$=$c_4$ is an instructional message about $n_2$=$c_3$ with contents $c_2$ intended for audience $n_4$=$c_1$.
$g_1$ (agent) fills $c_1$ with $c_2$.
$x_{1}$ is a packet/small pack containing $x_{2}$, held together by $x_{3}$
$b_1$ nibbles $b_2$ at locus $b_3$ with $b_4$.
$b_1$ is a/the cerebellum [body-part] of $b_2$.
$b_1$=$c_1$ decreases in size/becomes small to $b_2$ under conditions $b_3$.
$ca_1$=$cm_1$ is tiny/miniature/diminutive/very small in property $ca_2$=$cm_2$ to observer $ca_3$=$cm_3$.
$xa_1$=$ce_1$ is a small arm/gun for use against $xa_2$ by $xa_3$, launching small projectile $ce_2$=$cm_1$, defined as small arms by standard $cm_3$, projectile propelled by $ce_3$.
column3: The description is usually limited to revolvers, pistols, carbines, rifles, shotguns, submachine guns, assault rifles, sniper rifles etc. In the United States any firearm having a bore diameter of .50 caliber or less is normally considered a "small arm."

column2: $cu_1$ is a booklet/brochure about $cu_2$, written by $cu_3$ for intended audience $cu_4$ in medium $cu_5$=$cm_1$.

$cr_1$ is a fairy [tiny mythical humanoid] of mythos/religion $cr_2$
$t_1$ is a microscope used by $t_2$=$ca_1$ for looking at small things $t_2$=$ca_2$=$cm_1$ which are small in property/dimension(s) $cm_2$ (ka) as compared with standard/norm $cm_3$.
$x_1$ snacks on $x_2$
$x_1$ is mathematical notation which is used by $x_2$ to communicate $x_3$ and which adheres to rules/grammar $x_4$.
$x_1$ is a mathematician.

$b_1$=$c_1$ is a destroyer of type/carrying $b_2$, propelled by $b_3$.
$g_1$ causes $j_1$=$c_1$ to decrease in the smallness of property/dimension $c_2$ (ka) by amount $j_3$.
$z_1$=$k_3$ peeks at $z_2$=$k_2$ using $z_3$ under conditions $z_4$
$x_1$ is Brussels sprouts (vegetable)
$cmal_1$=$cman_1$is a hill in terrain $cman_2$, small by standard $cmal_3$.
$c_1$=$m_1$ is a chapel of religion $m_2$ at location $m_3$.

$x_1$ chuckles
column3: From la berenstein cribe 2020/11/17 See also {cmalu}, {cmila}

column2: $k_1$ is measured as $k_2$=$s_1$=$c_1$ (quantifier) teaspoon(s).
$s_1$=$m_1$=$c_1$ is a woodchip/splinter of wood type $m_2$, small as compared with standard/norm $c_3$.
$x_1$ is a Mandarin orange/tangerine/Citrus reticulata of species/variety/cultivar $x_2$
$n_1$ is a roll/bun/biscuit/bun made from grains $n_2$.

$x_1$ (text) is a lujvo with meaning $x_2$ and arguments $x_3$, and which is constructed from tanru/veljvo $x_4$ such that each element of the veljvo is ultimately only a cmavo (including "{zei}", "{ke}"/"{ke'e}", "{bo}", etc.), gismu, or rafsi of such cmavo or gismu.
column3: This word is itself a cmapagjvo. In intermediate stages of reducing/analyzing the veljvo $x_4$, some constituents themselves may be cmapagjvo; however, after a total reduction, all parts must be or represent cmavo and gismu, only. Contrast with "{brapagjvo}".

column2: $r_1$ is a  small-leafed/Baja rose (Rosa minutifolia) of species/strain $r_2$.

$p_1$ is an asteroid/meteoroid/bolide (before impact or atmospheric entry)/comet/planetoid/minor planet/dwarf planet/small celestial object (which nonetheless is bigger than dust or grains of sand/particulate) revolving around $p_2$ with planetary characteristics $p_3$, orbital parameters $p_4$.
column3: Location or orbital/trajectory characteristic does not matter so long as the object is distinct and enduring; this is an intrinsic property; thus, a bolide during or even after impact or entry may still be considered a cmaplini. Cf.: {solri}, {terdi}, {lunra}, {mluni}, {bisycmaplini}, {rokcmaplini}, {plinycma}, {jdikyplini}.

column2: $x_1$ is an asteroid belt, generalized Kuiper belt, or other such belt in stellar/star or planet-centered/planetary ring system $x_2$, extending over and throughout region $x_3$, including/containing objects or points of interest $x_4$, with other properties/orbital parameters $x_5$.
column3: This word is a {brapagjvo} involving "{jinrcaibyca'u}". Technically, this word should only be used when the region may be described as an example of a jinrcaibyca'u; thus, this word does not apply to and cannot be used in order to describe 'clouds' of celestial objects (such as the Oort Cloud) or more complicated regions of space which may exist in star systems with multiple major massive objects (such as binary star systems). It can, however, be used for planetary rings. See also: "{belta}", "{cmaplini}".

column2: $x_1$ ("ra'oi"-quote) is a short (reduced) rafsi/combining form of word/concept $x_2$ in language $x_3$.
column3: In Lojban, these are the three-letter rafsi for gismu and some cmavo (where .y'y is not counted as a letter for these purposes). Compare to "{brarafsi}".

$m_1$=$c_1$ is tiny/miniscule/diminutive in property/dimension(s) $c_2$ (ka) as compared with standard/norm $c_3$.

$x_1$=$c_1$=$t_1$ is a patch of land at $x_2$=$t_2$

$x_1$ is claustrophobic.
column3: Claustrophobia is a fear of small enclosed spaces. See also {noryraclyte'a}.

column2: $x_1$ is a small zevla meaning $x_2$.
column3: This word uses the experimental rafsi "-zve-" for the experimental gismu "{zevla}". This word is mostly intended for {zevla} which imitate {gismu}, such as "{raunte} for "{ronte}" or hypothetical "{gro'oxe}", perhaps "{xlei'eva}", etc. The boundaries of this category are fuzzy.

column2: $b_1$ is a pseudonym/pronoun, replacing real name $b_2$=$c_1$ of $x_3$=$c_2$ in circumstance $x_4$=$b_3$.
$x_1$ is anonymous to $x_2$; $x_1$ lacks a name to system/person $x_2$

$c_1$ (si'o) is a nominal scale of units [names and/or (meta-)categories and other qualitative classifications] for measuring/observing/determining $c_2$ (state).
$s_1$ identifies $s_2$=$c_2$ by name $c_1$ used-by namer/name-user $c_3$ (person).
$s_1$ is onomastics/onomatology of/about names $j_1$=$s_2$ based on methodology $s_3$.
$l_1$ is an onomasticon of names $l_2$=$c_1$ in order $l_3$ in medium $l_4$.
$t_1$ is a name tag/nameplate of $t_2$=$c_2$ showing text $c_1$.
$g_1$=$v_3$ registers $c_2$ with user-name $c_1$ on system/application $c_3$.
$x_1$ is a morphologically defined name word meaning $x_2$ in language $x_3$.
column3: In Lojban, such words are characterized by ending with a consonant. In Lojban, a {cmevla} may only consist of a single word, whereas a {cmene} can consist of one or multiple words, which may be cmevla. See also {vlaturge'a}.

column2: $x_1$ is a cmevla-based name for $x_2$ used by namer $x_3$
$b_1$=$c_1$ becomes a member of group $b_2$=$c_2$ under conditions $b_3$.
$x_1$ is a set with many members; $x_1$ is a set with a great cardinality.
$cm_1$=$cu_1$ votes for $cu_2$ among choices $cu_3$ in voting group $cm_2$.
column3: Applies to any election, not just public ones. Cf. {turni}.

column2: $k_1$ is suffrage entitled to $k_2$=$cu_1$ by standard $k_3$.
column3: It is a civil right, {selcemkrali}. Cf. {cmicu'a}.

column2: $g_1$ puts together $c_1$ into group $c_2$.
$x_1$ (collection/sequence) has $x_2$ (number) members
$s_1$=$c_1$ is logged into system/application $s_2$=$c_2$.
$g_1$=$v_3$ registers $c_1$ as a member of $c_2$, registration preserved in medium $x_3$=$v_4$.
$x_1$ is an eligible/potential voter in issue (list of options) $x_2$, (with $x_1$) being a voting member of group $x_3$.
$z_1$=$c_1$ participates in employing means/taking action $z_2$ for purpose/goal $z_3$.
$x_1$ entertains axiomatic belief that $x_2$ is the case.
$x_1$=$z2$=$j_1$ is an infrastructure built by $x_2$=$z$=$1$ out of $x_3$=$z_3$ for $x_4$=$j_2$
$x_1$ is an element of kind $x_2$ with purity $x_3$.
$x_1$ (du'u) is an axiom/doctrine/creed/postulate about subject $x_2$, foundational to system $x_3$
column3: $x_1$=$krici_2$=$jicmu_1$, $x_2$=$krici_3$, $x_3$=$jicmu_2$. The system may be religious, philosophical, scientific, or mathematical. Refers to any proposition assumed as true without being proved within the system itself. See {sruma}

column2: $d_1$=$c_1$ is a chisel for carving $d_2$=$c_2$ with blade of material $d_3$.

$x_1$ (li) is the (signed) difference between the average of all elements/data of $x_2$ (completely specified ordered multiset/list) and single number $x_3$ (li; default: infimum of $x_2$ under ordering $x_6$ if such is finite), using averaging function $x_4$ (default: arithmetic average), weights $x_5$ (completely specified ordered multiset/list with the same cardinality/length as $x_2$; default: according to notes), and inherited ordering $x_6$ (default: standard ordering on the set of reals).
column3: Default for $x_5$ is the same as the default for the weights of the given averaging function $x_4$, which for the arithmetic mean of a finite set is the ordered set of $|x_2|$ terms with each term equal identically to $1/|x_2|$, where "| |" represents the cardinality of its input (circumfixed). $x_6$ is defined on a superset of $x_2$ united with the singleton of $x_3$. The default for $x_6$ is {mrenspoi}. For example: If $x_2 = (1, 7)$ and all of the defaults hold, then $x_1 = avg(1,7) - min(1,7) = 4 - 1 = 3$; when all defaults hold and $x_2$ is a bounded set, $x_1$ is the difference between the arithmetic average of (or average of the uniform distribution on) $x_2$ and the infimum of $x_2$. See also: "{sigma}".

column2: $x_1$ makes $x_2$ vary in property $x_3$ in amount $x_4$ under conditions $x_5$
$x_1$ is the derivative of $x_2$ with respect to $x_3$.
$x_1$ is sensitive (easily offended, upset, or hurt).
$x_1$ feels $x_2$ (ka) about $x_3$ feeling $x_4$ (ka) about $x_5$
$co_1$=$ci_1$ hurts emotionally due to $ci_3$.
$d_1$=$c_1$ is far/distant from $d_2$ in feeling $d_3$=$c_2$.
$j_1$=$c_1$ shows emotion $j_2$=$c_2$ (ka) about $c_3$ to audience $j_3$.
$x_1$ empathizes with $x_2$ in feeling $x_3$.
$x_1$ emotionally believes $x_2$ (du'u) about subject $x_3$
column3: May or may not contrast with one's more-conscious or rational beliefs; related to the concept of "alief" ({kricili}). See {cinmo}, {krici}, {cnisenpi}

column2: $x_1$ 'reacts' with emoji $x_2$ ({ci'e'u}) to message/post $x_3$
$x_1$ is an emoji representing $x_2$
$x_1$=$c_1$=$m_1$ feels flattered about $x_2$=$c_3$=$m_2$.
$v_1$ is an interjection/attitudinal meaning $v_2$=$c_1$ in language $v_3$.
$x_1$=$m_1$ is a therapist treating $x_2$=$m_2$=$c_1$ for $x_3$=$m_3$=$c_2$ with treatment $x_4$=$m_4$.
$x_1$=$m_1$=$c_3$ is romantic to $x_2$=$m_2$; $x_1$ is beautiful to $x_2$ because it follows or is based on some emotional ideal that may not actually reflect reality.
column3: Not "romantic" in the sense of "pertaining to intimate love" (={cinpamra'a}); rather, "romantic" in the sense of viewing emotions as a higher and more important quality with extraordinary properties. See also {cinmo}, {melbi}.

column2: $x_1$ (event/state) feels (emotionally) good / pleasant / nice to $x_2$ under conditions $x_3$
$r_1$ is the sense/feeling in $c_1$ of emotion $c_2$ about $c_3$.
$x_1$=$p_1$ is a question about $x_3$=$c_2$=$p_4$’s emotion, asked by $x_2$=$p_3$ to $x_3$=$c_3$=$p_4$.
$x_1$=$r_1$ (event) moves/touches $x_2$=$c_1$ (person), causing emotion $x_3$=$c_2$ about object of emotion $x_4$=$c_3$ with causation conditions $x_5$=$r_3$; $x_1$=$r_1$ (event) is moving/touching.
$s_1$ is the heart (emotional self) of $s_2$=$c_1$.
$x_1$ emotionally disbelieves $x_2$ (du'u) about subject $x_3$
column3: May or may not contrast with one's more-conscious or rational beliefs; related to the concept of "alief" ({kricili}). See {cinmo}, {senpi}, {cnikri}

column2: $x_1$=$ci_1$=$cu_1$ expresses emotion $x_2$=$ci_2$=$cu_2$/emotionally expresses $x_2$ for audience $x_3$=$cu_3$ via expressive medium $x_4$=$cu_4$.
$t_1$=$c_2$ is the mood experienced by $t_2$=$c_1$ about $c_3$.
$x_1$ is emotionally stoical, impassible, tough-skinned.
$v_1$ sighs due to emotion $c_2$ (ka) about $c_3$ breathing/respiring $v_2$.
$x_1$ is therapy, given to patient $x_2$ for ailment $x_3$ by therapist $x_4$
$xr_1$ offends $xr_2$=$c_1$ affecting emotion $c_2$ (ka) about $c_3$ resulting in $xr_4$ (state).
$c_1$=$n_1$ is deep inside $n_2$ by standard $c_4$
column3: From la berenstein cribe 2020/11/17 See also {condi},{nenri}

column2: $x_1$=$p_1$ is the t(h)alweg (path following the deepest points along the course) in/of/belonging to geographical/hydrological/potential feature $x_2$=$c_1$=$t_1$ from $x_3$=$p_2$ to $x_4$=$p_3$
column3: Potential in the definition refers to the scalar field, a sense used in physics.

column2: $x_1$=$cf_1$ [state/event/process] commences/initiates/starts/begins to occur from its natural start; (intransitive verb).
column3: See {co'a} {cfari}. $x_1$ starts from the very beginning. Also in the sense of 'starting anew' or 'starting from scratch'.

column2: $b_1$ starts to become $b_2$ under conditions $b_3$.
$c_1$ (agent) starts to express/say $c_2$ (sedu'u/text/lu'e concept) for audience $c_3$ via expressive medium $c_4$.
$x_1$ is a sign language of $x_2$
column3: Replacement for ableist term {xanbau}, which appears to be based on misconceptions about signing and Deaf culture. Sign language is not "hand language". Any speaker of sign language can tell you that signing involves not just the hands, but the whole body: face, chest, lips, posture, facial expression/body language, lip movement, and so forth. Therefore, "corci" (gesture) makes a far better modifying component for this lujvo.

column2: $x_1$ kneels/genuflects with meaning $x_2$ on surface $x_3$ on/with limb(s) $x_4$ of body $x_5$.
column3: Usually implies obeisance, homage, devotion, loyalty, obedience, subservience, vulnerability, or some other form of inferiority or trust. Specify the recipient of said inferiority or trust expression via/in $x_2$. Mere "{cidytse}" is an action which may not convey any semantic information. This word uses experimental rafsi "-coc-", which has been proposed to be assigned to experimental gismu "{corci}". This word is, for now, equivalent to "{cidytsecorci}", mostly because .krtisfranks. cannot semantically distinguish between "a kneeling-type-of semantic-gesture" and "a semantic-gesture-type-of kneeling".

column2: $k_1$ plays charades/gesture-game $ci_1$=$k_2$ governed by rules $ci_2$ interrelating game parts (physical or conceptual; includes gestures) $ci_3$
column3: From {corci} {ciste} {kelci}. corci1 is included in ciste3. See also {cockei}

column2: $s_1$=$c_1$ is a deep/rumbling sound produced by $s_2$=$c_2$ from point of reference $c_3$.
column3: $c_3$ could also be interpreted as a particular pitch/frequency. See also: {condi}, {sance}.

column2: $x_1$ is a thingamajig / thing which the speaker can't put a predicate upon
$x_1$ makes $x_2$ be in some unspecified relation with $x_3$; $x_1$ assigns / pairs up $x_2$ and $x_3$.
$c_1$=$b_1$ is a deep-sea submarine for carrying $b_2$, propelled by $b_3$
$g_1$ (agent) hurts/causes pain for $c_1$ at locus $c_2$.
$x_1$ quits/stops/aborts waiting/pausing for/until $x_2$ at state $x_3$ and starts/continues with $x_4$ (activity/process).
column3: The pause waiting is not completed. See {co'u}, {denpa}.

column2: $d_1$ is relieved from stress/discomfort $d_2$
$x_1$ (event) has ceased happening and is not expected to start again.
$j_1$ dies / ceases to live; alive according to standard $j_2$.
$g_1$ causes $c_1$ to [rest on]/[be on top of]/[lie on] $c_2$ in frame of reference $c_3$.
column5: cause to be on top;cause to lie on;cause to rest on

column2: $g_1$=$c_1$ rides/mounts/has sexual intercourse on top of $g_2$=$c_2$, in frame of reference/gravity $c_3$.
$f_1$=$c_1$ refuses $f_2$=$c_2$ from $c_3$.
$z_1$=$c_1$ approves the receipt of $c_2$ from $c_3$.
$x_1$ ask each other for/request from each other $x_2$ in manner/form $x_3$
$cu_1$=$cp_1$ pleas/[expresses request] $cu_2$ (sedu'u/text/lu'e concept)  to $cu_3$=$cp_3$ via expressive medium $cu_4$.
column5: ask for by saying;request by saying

column2: $x_1$ complies with/accedes to request $x_2$ made by $x_3$.
$x_1$ complies with request $x_2$ from $x_3$.
$x_1$ is a gryphon/griffin/griffon.
$s_1$ is a sense-irritating plant/thistle of species $x_2$.
$t_1$=$c_1$ is a hot/pungent spice causing flavor/effect $t_2$ (event/property).
$x_1$ is a scarecrow for scaring off birds $x_2$
$z_1$ is a nest of bird $z_2$=$c_1$ of genus/species/etc. $c_2$.
$b_1$=$l_1$ is/are (an) ox/oxen [cattle/beef-producer/bovine] for pulling/drafting $l_2$ by handle $l_3$ of species/breed $b_2$.
$c_1$ is a horse cab/carriage/equipage for carrying $c_2$, propelled by animal(s) $l_1$=$c_3$ by handle/at locus $l_3$.
$x_1$ is a rowing boat or sculler, carrying $x_2$, pulled by $x_3$.
$x_1$ rows or sculls on route $x_2$ with boat, rowing boat or scull $x_3$.
$l_1$=$m_1$ is a tractor pulling $l_2$.
$g_1$=$l_1$ pulls $m_1$=$l_2$ to destination $m_2$ from origin $m_3$ over path/route $m_4$ at handle/locus $l_3$.
$p_1$ is a harpsichord.
$c_1$ is a radio transceiver transmitting/receiving $c_2$ on frequency $c_3$ to/from transceiver $c_4$.
column3: The $x_3$ place may specify more than one frequency, for instance in cases where different frequencies are used for transmission and receipt. Cf. {veltivni}.

column2: $s_1$ is a front vowel sound.
$ci_1$=$cr_1$ is a heads-up display (HUD) for user $s_1$ of machine/system $s_2$ based on principle $ci_3$. It is shown/visible in front of $cr_2$, as seen from the user's viewpoint.
column3: A very general sense of “heads-up display” is used here; it is not limited to one single application. For example, it could be used to refer to both the heads-up display of modern aircraft as well as the heads-up display in computing and video games. Cf. {crane}, {sazycimde}.

column2: $k_1$=$c_1$ advances to $k_2$ from $k_3$=$c_2$ via $k_4$ using means/vehicle $k_5$.
$k_1$ is an anteroom of/in structure $k_2$ surrounded by partitions/walls/ceiling/floor $k_3$ (mass/jo'u).
$l_1$ is an initial letter in alphabet/character-set $l_2$ representing $l_3$.
$t_1$=$c_1$ is/are the frontmost among set/range $t_4$ which faces/in-frame-of-reference $c_3$.
column3: Be careful not to use this when {li'enrai} is meant.  Their meanings may overlap somewhat.

column2: $x_1$ is a president; $x_1$ is president of $x_2$
column3: Wide sense; like {jatna}, plus the "president" title. See also {ianlaua}, {gugja'a}, {kagja'a}, {presidente}

column2: $v_1$=$c_1$ is a front door/gateway/access between $v_2$ and $v_3$ of structure $v_4$.
$p_1$ is the front-cover picture/image/illustration showing $p_2$ made by artist $p_3$.
column5: front cover illustration;front cover image;front cover picture

column2: $c_1$=$b_1$ becomes expert at $c_2$=$b_2$ under conditions $b_3$ by standard $c_3$.
column3: Coined because {cilre} makes it hard to talk about just learning about a subject. Cf. {ckule}, {saske}, {ctuca}.

column2: $x_1$ (event) is a test/examination of $x_2$'s skill/competence in subject $x_3$
$x_1$ learns the skill of having property $x_2$.
$j_1$=$c_2$ is a profession (job) of person $j_2$=$c_1$.
column3: Especially a job requiring a high level of skill or training. Cf. {jibri}, {gunka}, {certu}.

column2: $cu_1$ is a barista/is skilled at making coffee drink/product $cu_2$=$ck_1$ by process $cu_3$.
column3: See also espresso (={kafrspreso}), coffeehouse/coffee bar (={kafybarja}), espresso machine (={cabrspreso}).

column2: $x_1$ does $x_2$ in a skilled manner
$x_1$ (person) has rank/skill level $x_2$ (li) in discipline/game/activity $x_3$
$x_1$=$ce_1$=$cu_1$ expertly produces artwork $x_2$=$cu_2$ of craft/skill $x_3$=$ce_2$=$l_2$ by process $x_4$=$cu_3$ expertly produced by standard $x_5$=$ce_3$.
$x_1$ suggests/offers expert advice/protip $x_2$ (ka) to $x_3$.
$j_1$=$c_1$ skillfully handles $j_2$=$c_2$ in event $j_3$.
$c_1$=$xa_1$ is a geek/nerd of field $c_2$=$xa_2$ (event/activity) by standard $c_3$.
$x_1$ practices/exercises/drills/trains in/for action/event/performance $x_2$.
$x_1$ is bearberry of species/variety $x_2$.
$s_1$ (mass of facts) is the science of fairies/elves/pixies [mythical humanoid] of mythos/religion $c_2$ based on methodology $s_3$.
column5: science of elves;science of fairies;science of gnomes;science of goblins;science of mythical humanoids;science of pixies;science of sprites

column2: $x_1$=$g_1$ causes $x_2$=$c_1$ to lose property $x_3$=$c_2$
column3: The third place of cirko is the event itself. cf. {cirko} and {gasnu}

column2: $x_0$: No pain, no gain. You have to work for what you want. (nullary predicate)
$x_1$ is a painkiller for locus (body part) $x_2$
$g_1$ (agent) hurts/causes pain for $c_1$ at locus $c_2$.
$g_1$ practices sadomasochism with $g_2$=$c_1$ with pain at locus $c_2$.
$r_1$ (event/state) hurts/causes pain for $x_2$=$c_1$ at locus $x_3$=$c_2$.
$t_1$ is hot spice.
$v_1$ is a hot/spicy taste/flavor of/emitted by $v_2$.
$x_1$=$j_1$=$c_1$ is a rule permitting/allowing $x_2$=$j_2$=$c_2$ (event/state) within system/community $x_3$=$j_3$ under conditions $x_4$=$c_3$
column3: The use of $c_1$ there is perhaps a bit iffy; the point here is that it's non-agentive.

column2: $t_1$ is a situation / condition / state / position that allows / is sufficient for event $c_2$=$t_2$ under conditions $c_3$.
column3: As the whole point of this word is to ignore the agentive nature of c1, c1 has been dropped.  Cf. {curmi}, {tcini}, {rau}, {banzu}.

column2: $v_1$ is a permit allowing $c_2$ (event) under conditions $c_3$, preserved in medium $v_4$.
$x_1$ is a type theory.
$k_1$=$c_1$ is the audit committee of $k_3$.
$x_1$ is a nightjar/goatsucker/whippoorwill of genus/species $x_2$.
$c_1$ is an owl of species $c_2$.
$c_1$ is a slipper (shoe primarily for wearing at night) for wearing on [feet/hooves] $c_2$, made of material $c_3$.
$d_1$ is dew.
$m_1$ is dark of night of day $n_2$ at location $n_3$.
$m_1$ is the midnight of $n_2$ at location $n_3$.
$c_1$ is nocturnal/active during the nighttime $n_1$.
$f_1 = r_1 = x_1$ (event; perhaps: spacetime coordinates) is an equinox for season $x_2$ at location/of or for celestial body/object $d_3 = x_3$ with respect to orbit/sun $x_4$.
column3: This word is perfectly and exactly semantically equivalent to "{dornilteikeznulfau}", except at most in terms of emphasis and connotation and poetic value. Unlike the pair "{ctenilteikezraifau}" and "{dornilteikezraifau}", neither of the "equinox" words herein referenced thus far have a default or preference for any given season.

column2: $f_1 = r_1 = x_1$ (event; perhaps: spacetime coordinates) is a solstice of extreme $r_3 = x_2$ ("ka" construct or season; default: "ka zmadu", which means "Winter solstice", unless context makes this interpretation untenable) at location/of or for celestial body/object $d_3 = x_3$ with respect to orbit/sun $x_4$.
column3: This word is exactly analogous to "{dornilteikezraifau}" and (conceptually speaking) does nothing other than merely multiplying dornilteikezraifau$_2$ by $-1$. All of the notes and commentary for that word apply here. See also: "{ctenilteikeznulfau}".

column2: $x_1$ is a nightingale of species/variety $x_2$.
$s_1$ is a supper composed of dishes including $s_2$.
$cin_1$ is a/are chopstick(s) for eating $cit_2$.
$d_1$ is a table knife for cutting food $d_2$=$c_2$, with blade of material $d_3$.
$x_1$ has appetite for $x_2$
$x1$=$s1$=$c2$ is a caviar made of the roe of fish species $x2$=$s2$=$f2$
$f_1$ is a table fork for eating $c_2$, having tines/prongs $f_3$ on base/support $f_4$.
column3: cf. {ctidakfu}, {ctitci}. Note that {forca} is specific enough in most contexts, even more so than {dakfu}, due to not being confusable with t.ex. {tamcydakfu}.

column2: $g_1$ feeds $c_1$ with food $c_2$.
$x1$=$k1$ is a bowl for food $x2$=$c2$=$k2$ made from material $x3$=$k3$
$sm_1$=$b_1$ is/are tablespoon(s) [item of cutlery] suitable for eating $sm_2$=$c_2$ made of material $s_3$.
$k_1$ is a dining room in structure $k_2$ surrounded by partitions/walls/ceiling/floor $k_3$ (mass/jo'u).
$t_1$ is a quantity of/contains/is made of asphalt from source $t_2$
$x_1$ is an oil lamp using petroleum-based products, illuminating $x_2$ with light $x_1$.
$v_1$ is a fuel tank.
$x_1$ is a squirrel.
column3: Etymology: Sciuridae, from skíouros, “squirrel”, from σκιά (skiá, “shadow”) + οὐρά (ourá, “tail”).

column2: $p_1$ sets up diet $p_2$ for $c_1$ consisting of food $c_2$.
$p_1$ is the digestion of food $p_2$=$c_2$ with output $p_3$ passing through stage $p_4$ of person/animal/plant $c_1$.
$g_1$ digests food $p_2$=$c_2$ with output $p_3$ passing through stage $p_4$ of person/animal/plant $c_1$.
$s_1$ celebrates $s_2$ with a banquet/feast.
$t_1$ is cutlery for eating $c_2$.
$x_1$ is edible to $x_2$
$d1$ is $d2$ full hectodays (hundred day unit) in duration (default is 1 hectoday) by standard $d3$
column3: For use with metric dating system.

column2: $x_1$ is a charizard [pokemon]
$x_1$ is $x_2$ centuries in duration by standard $x_3$.
$ci_1$ is an education system interrelated by administrative policies $ci_2$ among institutions $ci_3$=$ct_1$ displaying quality $ci_4$.
$cu_1$=$ct_1$ is a textbook for teaching ideas/methods $ct_3$ (du'u), by author $cu_3$ for audience $cu_4$=$ct_2$ about subject(s) $ct_4$ by method $ct_5$, preserved in medium $cu_5$.
$f_1$ is a lesson by $c_1$ for teaching audience $c_2$ ideas/methods/lore $c_3$ (du'u) about subject(s) $c_4$ by method $c_5$ (event).
$x_1$=$g_1$=$c_2$ works on $x_2$=$g_2$=$c_5$ for teacher $x_3$=$c_1$ to learn facts $x_4$=$c_3$ about subject $x_5$=$c_4$
$n_1$ are instructions by $c_1$ teaching audience $c_2$ ideas/methods/lore $c_3$ (du'u) about subject(s) $c_4$ by method $c_5$ (event).
$x_1$=$n_1$=$c_5$ is a lecture / an event of verbal teaching by $x_2$=$t_1$=$c_1$ to audience $x_3$=$t_2$=$c_2$ about subject $x_4$=$t_3$=$c_4$ in language $x_5$=$t_4$ with facts taught $x_6$=$c_3$.
$x_1$ is a class (instructional session) on topic $x_2$ taught by $x_3$ to audience $x_4$
column3: Refers to a single event, e.g. "I have a class at 3:30." For a  course of instruction, see {ctusfimei}.

column2: $x_1$ is a course (series of lessons) on subject $x_2$, taught by $x_3$ to audience $x_4$
column3: Refers to a full course of instruction, i.e. a curriculum or series of individual lessons at an educational institution. For an individual lesson, see {ctusfi}.

column2: $cm_1$=$cu_1$ is a member of electorate $cm_2$, which votes/selects $cu_2$ [choice] from set/sequence of alternatives $cu_3$.
column3: Gismu deep structure is "cuxna gi'e cmima"; Cf. {turni}, {cmicu'a}, {gubycu'a}, {jecta}.

column3: In Lojban, cunrafsi are {rafsi} (bound combining forms) that derive unpredictably from {gismu} (root predicate-words). They are morphemes of the forms CCV, CVC, CVV, and CV'V (where C is a consonant, V is a vowel, and ' is the special sound /h/). Rafsi of these forms must be memorized alongside their source gismu, since they are assigned arbitrarily (within some constraints). By contrast, rafsi of the forms CCVC and CVCC are always predictable, and match up one-for-one with gismu; these may be called {jvarafsi} ('rule-rafsi'). Note also: cunrafsi are not 'irregular' in the sense of being assigned informally in a non-standard manner; they are a part of standard, official Lojban.

To refer to what is often named simply "just intonation" but instead means 5-limit just intonation, use "cuvyto'aci'e li mu". See also: {dunto'aci'e}.

$x_1$ (node in graph) is near $x_2$ (node in same connected graph component), such that they are path-connected, along path(s) $x_3$ (default: at least one pairwise graph geodesic, with no restriction on which paths are considered) according to edge weighings $x_4$ in connected graph component $x_5$, with nearness standard/satisfying other conditions $x_6$.
column3: $x_1$ need not be distinct from $x_2$, but they must share a connected graph component (undefined otherwise or if no clear graph/connecting relationship exists). See also: "{toryrailu'a}".

column2: $x_1$ (node in graph) is among the very nearest nodes to $x_2$ (node in same graph), such that they are path-connected, along path(s) or paths of type $x_3$ (default: directed graph geodesics from $x_2$ to candidate other nodes, such that each of these candidates (plus $x_1$) are pairwise distinct from $x_2$) according to edge weighings $x_4$ in connected graph component $x_5$, with nearness standard/satisfying other conditions $x_6$, the extreme $x_7$ (default: ka zmadu, implying most-near) being amongst set/range $x_8$ of candidate nodes.
column3: Multiple nodes may be equally near to $x_2$ for a given geodesic distance; $x_1$ is such that the geodesic distance between it and $x_2$ is positive but otherwise minimal (however, this does not necessarily uniquely specify/define/designate $x_1$). $x_1$, $x_2$, and elements of/nodes in $x_3$, $x_5$, and $x_8$ must all share a single edge-connected graph component, namely $x_5$; this word's referent is undefined/errors out otherwise or if no clear graph/connecting relationship exists. Path type for $x_3$ should define/be defined by a restrictive characteristic. Default value of $x_7$ is "ka zmadu", meaning "the quality of being most-near to $x_2$ under the aforementioned conditions, in the same connected graph component, according to aforementioned measurement methods, etc.", as opposed to (for example) "ka mleca", which means "the quality of being the least-near/most-far from $x_2$ under the aforementioned conditions, in the same connected graph component, according to aforementioned measurement methods, etc.". $x_1$ and $x_2$ each are a candidate node for the purposes of this definition. The condition of pairwise distinctness between candidates from $x_2$ may be relaxed by specification of or removal of definitional default for $x_3$. See also: "{toryrailu'a}", "{grafyjbi}".
column5: most-recent;nearest in graph;nearest node in graph

column2: $g_1$=$j_2$=$f_2$ is a singularity/black hole with point-like gravity well $f_4$=$j_1$ with mass of $g_2$ kilograms.
$b_1$ ferries $b_2$=$p_1$ to $b_3$=$p_3$ from $b_4$=$p_4$ over barrier/medium/portal $b_5$=$p_2$.
$b_1$ is a ferry boat for carrying $b_2$ over barrier/medium/portal $x_3$=$p_2$ to destination $x_4$=$p_3$ from origin $x_5$=$p_4$.
$g_1$ makes $x_2$=$p_1$ pass through $x_3$=$p_2$ to destination side $x_4$=$p_3$ from origin side $x_5$=$p_4$.
$x_1$=$k_1$ is a hole in $x_2$=$k_2$=$p_2$ to/between $x_3$=$p_3$ from/and $x_4$=$p_4$ permitting passage by $x_5$=$p_1$.
column3: {pagre} + {kevna}. Precisely, $x_2$ is the barrier, $x_3$ is the inside, and $x_4$ is the outside, if distinguishable; loosely, $x_2$ might be given as the object consisting of both the barrier and the inside.

column2: $x_1$=$p_1$=$k_1$ passes through portal/generically exits or enters via portal (entrance/exit) $x_2$=$p_2$ to destination side $x_3$=$p_3$=$k_2$ from origin side $x_4$=$p_4$=$k_3$ via route $x_5$=$k_4$ using means/vehicle $x_6$=$k_5$.
column3: $x_5$, in its fullest possible description, must include $x_2$. This word emphasises movement or transportation, usually unidirectional for any given $x_1$ at any given time (not simultaneously bidirectional nor back-and-forth). It is meant to be a generic form of "{nerkla}" and "{barkla}", and is intended to approximate/analogize/extend their veljvo compositions. Aside from the aforementioned emphasis and intent, as well as the terbri, it is quite similar to "{pagre}" itself, although their might be further slight connotational differences (such as the means of passage through the barrier and the type of barrier involved, whether being able to remain on both sides of the barrier statically is within scope of definition (it might be for "pagre" but is not for this word, at least to any significant extent), etc.). $x_2$ is an exit or entrance when generic terminology is desired; a generic word for a portal or doorway (see: "{vorme}") technically is always equivalent, so long as the portal is open and functional, but we often conceptualize exits and entrances (whether unidirectional or bidirectional according to their designs) as being to or from the overall structure (such as a house or vehicle) and not merely internal to it (such as a bedroom or bathroom doorway in a house), and this word is intended to capture this implication more explicitly.
column5: enter or exit;exit or enter;pass through

column2: $s_2$ is the anthem of $g_1$.
$p_1$ is a subset of $g_1$.
$x_1$ is the product (combined multiplication result) of $x_2$ (plurality of the same type as $x_1$)
$x_1$ is the sum (combined addition result) of $x_2$ (plurality of the same type as $x_1$)

$x_1 = t_1$ is the elapsed time required for decaying/diminishing/reducing/shrinking population $x_2 = g_1$ to decrease in number by a factor of exactly/approximately $1/e^{(x_3)}$ from that which is considered to be the initial population size, where $e$ is the natural exponential base and $x_3$ [li; default: 1] is a real number, according to standard/under condition/by model/in experiment $x_4$; $x_1$ is the one-$(e^{(x_3)})$-th-life of population/sample $x_2$; the (approximate) $(x_3)$-th one-e-th-ing/e-fold decrease(/increase) of population $x_2$ takes approximately $x_1$ (time).
column3: The experimental gismu {tezda} is used in the veljvo of this word. Many of the veljvo terbri can be derived from those which are present. This word may refer to a duration that is statistical (for large samples, the average time required for half of the population to probably disappear/become invalid), ideal (guaranteed rather than statistical), or experimental (in a given trial, some number was recorded on a stopwatch when the count decreased by half). This word is analogous not only to half-life (default sense) but also to doubling time (if $x_3$ is filled by $-1$). See also: {grixabybi'otei}, {grixonbybi'otei}.

column2: $x_1 = t_1$ is the elapsed time required for decaying/diminishing/reducing/shrinking population $x_2 = g_1$ to decrease in number by a factor of exactly/approximately half according to standard/under condition/by model/in experiment $x_3$; $x_1$ is the half-life of population/sample $x_2$; the (approximate) halving of population $x_2$ takes approximately $x_1$ (dimensionful number: time).
column3: Many of the veljvo terbri can be derived from those which are present. This word may refer to a duration that is statistical (for large samples, the average time required for half of the population to probably disappear/become invalid), ideal (guaranteed rather than statistical), or experimental (in a given trial, some number was recorded on a stopwatch when the count decreased by half). See also: {gritezdybi'otei}, {grixonbybi'otei}.

column2: $x_1 = t_1$ is the elapsed time required for decaying/diminishing/reducing/shrinking population $x_2 = g_1$ to decrease in number by a factor of exactly/approximately $1/(x_3)$ from that which is considered to be the initial population size, where $x_3$ [li; default: 1] is a positive real number, according to standard/under condition/by model/in experiment $x_4$; $x_1$ is the $(x_3^{(-1)})$-th-life of population/sample $x_2$; the (approximate) one-$x_3$-th-ing/$(x_3)$-fold decrease(/increase) of population $x_2$ takes approximately $x_1$ (time).
column3: The experimental gismu {xonba} is used in the veljvo of this word. Many of the veljvo terbri of this word can be derived from those which are present. This word may refer to a duration that is statistical (for large samples, the average time required for half of the population to probably disappear/become invalid), ideal (guaranteed rather than statistical), or experimental (in a given trial, some number was recorded on a stopwatch when the count decreased by half). This word is analogous not only to half-life (and means it exactly if $x_3$ is filled by $2$) but also to doubling time (and means it exactly if $x_3$ is filled by $1/2$). See also: {grixabybi'otei}, {gritezdybi'otei}.

column3: Usually includes more than just cereals.

$c_1$ votes (in a public election) for $c_2$ among choices $c_3$ in electorate $g_2$.
$s_1$=$k_3$=$g_1$ is a parliamentary republic with representatives $s_2$=$k_1$ representing community $g_2$=$k_2$ (mass)

$s_1$=$g_1$ is a republic governed by people $s_2$=$g_2$

column3: From {gubni} {si'o} {ckaji}.  In English, usually '$x_1$ is the reputation for $x_3$ that $x_2$ has with $x_4$'.

column2: $x_1$ experiences g-LoC / g-force-induced loss of consciousness.
$n_1$ is $n_2$ years in duration by the Gregorian calendar.
$u_1$=$g_1$ is a frame enclosing widget(s) $g_2$ in user interface $u_2$
$u_1$ is a radio button, part of radio button group $g_1$, in user interface $u_2$.
$x_1$ is a strawberry of species/breed $x_2$.
$x_1$ is an ash of species/variety $x_2$.
$x_1$ is a fractal with properties $x_2$
column3: Fractal is a geometric figure that repeats itself under several levels of magnification, and that shows self-similarity on all scales. See also {pixra}, {cartu}, {panra}, {ckilu}

column2: $x_1$ is a blackberry/raspberry/bramble of species $x_2$.
$x_1$ is a buckthorn of species/variety $x_2$.

$x_1$ reflects/relates to/pertains to Gothic (French-originating, High or Late Medieval, post-Romanesque pre-Renaissance) style/aesthetic/art/architecture/practice in aspect $x_2$
column3: Probably not restricted to pieces from the original time period, as long as it relates to the style in some way. Does not refer to the various Goths peoples in a contemporaneous manner, nor to the 'emo/goth' style (dark clothes, etc.).

column2: $x_1$ (text) is an example of witticism, quip about $x_2$ by $x_3$
$x_1$ is a quantity of dark matter/dark gravitation [unknown thing with gravitational consequences] with properties $x_2$
column3: If scientists eventually figure out that dark matter is not a thing at all but, for example, the result of a mathematical correction to our present understanding of gravitation, this word may need to be redefined to something similar to "$x_1$ relates to dark matter/dark gravitation in manner/aspect $x_2$", or whatsoever is fitting, or it could be deleted all together.

column2: $x_1$ is a fresco
$x1$ pertains to the Fertile Crescent region/geography/nationality/culture/history in property/aspect $x2$
$x_1$ and $x_2$ are in relation $x_3$ with different things (i.e. not the same things).
$x_1$ is a boiled meatball (meal; a ball of minced or ground meat, boiled) consisting of $x_2$
column3: {polpeta} is a more generic term. See also {tefteli}, {sanmi}, {rectu}

column2: $x_1$ is a fricassee, pieces of chicken or other meat stewed in gravy with e.g. carrots and onions and served with noodles or dumplings
$x_1$ (an artiodactyl, usually a bovine) is intersex because of an opposite-sex twin; $x_1$ is a freemartin
$x_1$ experiencing $x_2$ is prevented by $x_3$; $x_1$ misses (one sense) $x_2$
$x_1$ is a friterie / baraque à frites / friture / frituur / frietkot / frietkraam serving fast food $x_2$ to $x_3$.
column3: A particular type of fast food restaurant, selling fries and usually a variety of other deep-fried snacks and sauces, as found in Belgium, the Netherlands and Northern France. The place structure models {gusta}.

column2: $x_1$ is a frustum/cone/cylinder/pyramid made of material $x_2$ with larger base $x_3$ and at-most-as-large base $x_4$, with other characteristics $x_5$.
column3: $x_4$ cannot be larger in hyperarea than $x_3$. A cone and a pyramid are degenerate frusta with exactly one base ($x_4$) being exactly a point (the apex); a line segment is a doubly-degenerate frustum with $x_3$ (and therefore $x_4$) being a point. The bases should typically be approximately parallel to one another; they need not be perpendicular to their axis. Except possibly when at least one base is a point, they will be (apprpximately) geometrically similar to one another (having the same cross-section along parallel planes wrt the axis, modulo scale/size, which will nonetheless be multiplied by a uniform factor in all 'dimensions'). A round base will produce, approximately, a circular cone or a (circular) cylinder.

column2: $x_1$ is a bandersnatch of species $x_2$
Franz Kafka
digit/number: first Foias' constant; the unique value of $x_1$ such that $x_n$  -> ∞ as n -> ∞ for $x_{n+1}  = (1 + (1/( x_n )))^n$; such $x_1$ = 1.187…
digit/number: second Foias constant; the value x for which $(1/x)(1 + (1/x))^x=1$ is true; ≈ 2.293…

discursive: 
{fu'au} - luckily
{fu'aucu'i} - not pertaining to luck
{fu'aunai} - unluckily.
column3: Expresses fortune/misfortune of the speaker. Use {dai} to express fortune/misfortune of the listener. See also {funca}.

column2: begin within-context quote.
column3: Terminated by {fu'o}. Quoted text need not be grammatical on its own, but must be grammatical in context with the surrounding text.

column2: discursive: indicate a change in speaker to fo'a; used generally in quotations.
column3: Considered to have sa'a attached to it by default. Using sa'anai would cancel that effect. Used to quote dialogues.

column2: discursive: indicate a change in speaker to fo'e; used generally in quotations.
column3: Considered to have sa'a attached to it by default. Using sa'anai would cancel that effect. Used to quote dialogues.

column2: discursive: indicate a change in speaker to fo'i; used generally in quotations.
column3: Considered to have sa'a attached to it by default. Using sa'anai would cancel that effect. Used to quote dialogues.

column2: discursive: indicate a change in speaker to fo'o; used generally in quotations.
column3: Considered to have sa'a attached to it by default. Using sa'anai would cancel that effect. Used to quote dialogues.

column2: discursive: indicate a change in speaker to fo'u; used generally in quotations.
column3: Considered to have sa'a attached to it by default. Using sa'anai would cancel that effect. Used to quote dialogues.

column2: $x_1$ is a fortepiano
attitudinal modifier: \n{fu'i } - easy\n{fu'i nai} - difficult.
$x_{1}$ (passive) floats on/in fluid (gas/liquid) $x_{2}$; $x_{1}$ is buoyant.
$x_{1}$ (event/property) is determined by the luck/fortune of $x_{2}$; (note mabla/zabna not implied). $x_{1}$ is determined by chance.
$x_{1}$ rots/decays/ferments with decay/fermentation agent $x_{2}$; $x_{1}$ is rotten/decayed/fermented.
$x_{1}$ is responsible/accountable for $x_{2}$ (action/resulting state) to judge/authority $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a cover/[lid/top] for covering/concealing/sheltering $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is an article/descriptor labelling description $x_{2}$ (text) in language $x_{3}$ with semantics $x_{4}$.
column3: $x_2$ is the noun phrase/sumti without the article/descriptor; description (($x_1$ with $x_2$) = gadysu'i); note: 'determiner' has become the accepted general linguistics term, displacing 'article'; however, 'determiner' includes all words that can introduce a noun phrase/sumti, whether a description or not, such as pronoun possessives like lemi, quantifiers (especially in indefinites) like ci and su'o, and demonstratives like ti, ta, and tu; the term 'descriptor' in Lojban, is limited to words that introduce descriptions (excluding indefinites), such as those of selma'o LA and LE, their common compounds such as lemi, and possibly lenu.  'article' typically refers only to a single word; Lojban assumes the broader meaning] See also {valsi}, {cmavo}.

column2: end indicator long scope; terminates scope of all active indicators.
n-ary mathematical operator: elliptical/unspecified mathematical expression (mex) operator.
letteral for f.
logical connective: forethought all but tanru-internal or (with gi).
{zgana} modal, 1st place                            to observer ... ; witnessed by ...
upper-case letteral shift.

attitudinal modifier/honorific: 
{ga'i} - hauteur; used with one of lower rank.
{ga'icu'i} - equal rank
{ga'inai} - meekness
digit/number: hex digit C (decimal 12) [twelve].
$x_1$ is a loanword meaning $x_2$ in language $x_3$, based on word $x_4$ in language $x_5$.
$x_1$ is a copy/clone of a copy/clone of ... a copy/clone of $x_2$ through intermediate steps $x_3$ (ce'o).
$r_1$ is the rafsi prefix used in stage-3 fu'ivla $v_1$=$f_1$, rafsi based on word $r_2$.
column3: “rafsi prefix” is a term specific to Lojban and refers to the initial part of a stage-3 fu'ivla which is a rafsi. $x_2$ is the word in which the rafsi is used, $x_3$ is the word from which the rafsi has been derived. See also: {cibyfu'ivla}, {fu'ivla}, {rafsi}.

column2: $f_1$=$z_1$=$p_1$ holds the copyright for copying $f_2$=$p_2$ under law $p_3$.
column3: Copyright itself might be "si'o fukzifypo'e". If you are actually translating something with a copyright notice, you should leave the notice in the original language.

column2: $t_1$=$f_1$ is a raft of material $t_2$ shape $t_3$ floating on $f_2$.

column3: Fermented bean paste is a category of fermented foods typically made from ground soybeans, which are indigenous to the cuisines of East and Southeast Asia, such as miso.

column3: The process of this is called “deposition” or “desublimation” in English. From “{gapci} {dunja}”; refers to a direct change of the state of matter from gaseous to solid. Cf. {ligyfebvi}.

column2: $x_1$ is a quantity of steam/water vapor

column3: cuxna2 is deleted; galfi1 was raised from an event abstraction to a person agent; the third sumti slot of this word is not predictable from veljvo (but is inspired by galfi2). x3 is the interface feature which the choices modify; for example, x3 can be the sound amplitude ('loudness') feature/setting on a speaker and x1 is a set of values for that feature (according to some scale) which can be achieved by the speaker output.

column2: $x_1$ (agent) causes $x_2$ (event) to modify/alter/change/transform/convert $x_3$ into $x_4$
column3: This is a {jvajvo}: {galfi} {zei} {gasnu}. Included in the dictionary because it's referenced in the notes for {galfi}.

column2: $x_1$=$z_1$=$g_1$ is a zmico that modifies the terbri default specification of a brivla, producing result $x_2$=$z_2$=$g_3$ at level/with construct-orientation $x_3$=$z_3$ with discourse duration $x_4$=$z_4$ in language $x_5$=$z_5$; $x_1$ is a default specification modifier that produces output re-specification $x_2$
column3: {zmico} is an experimental gismu. See also: {zmico}, {sumyzmico}

column2: $m_1$=$g_1$ is a cover/[lid/top] for sheltering $m_2$=$g_2$ from danger/threat $m_3$.

$x_1$ is a hazel (nut/tree) of species $x_2$
$x_1$ is a part of Lojban text representing rule 'operator' according to the first edition of the book 'The Complete Lojban Language'.
column3: Inner structure of the rule: operator-1 (joik-jek operator-1 | joik stag? KE # operator /KEhE#/)*. For the description of the syntax see {jarnezi}.

column2: $x_1$ (plural of ordered pairs) is an exhaustive set (possibly infinite) of inputs/outputs defining a unary function which yields result $x_3$ when given input $x_2$; $x_1$($x_2$) = $x_3$
column3: f(x) = z == "fy funtiio xy fi zy". "lo ro se {zilbri} be lo ka ce'u {sumji} ce'u li pa" is a way to extract the input/output set of the relation "f(x) = x−1", so that you can use it as funtiio's x1. Using a la-name for referring to a function is also an option, for example "la .fankcyn. cu funtiio li re li ci". See also {fancu}, {fancuka}.

column2: $x_1$ is dandruff in/on $x_2$ caused by $x_3$.
$x_1$ is a furcula/wishbone/merrythought/fused clavicle (body part) of $x_2$.
$x_1$ rusts
$x_1$ (la'e zo BY/word-bu) is a capital/capitalised/upper-shift letter/digit/symbol in alphabet/character-set $x_2$ representing $x_3$.
$x_1$ (ka) is the case (uppercase or lowercase) of letter $x_2$ in orthography $x_3$
digit/number: twenty-one (decimal 21).

Number suffix initiating a subordinate clause representing a predicate whose arity is the suffixed number; the lambda variables representing the predicate slots are bound from the fo'a-fo'u series in their dictionary ordering; the number of bound variables is the same as the predicate arity.
column3: For example, if the selected arity is two (re fy'oi), then only {fo'a} and {fo'e} are bound, and {fo'i} etc. are not bound. Terminator: {ku'au}.

column2: unary mekso operator: Lorentz-Einstein gamma factor $+1/((1-(|X|^2))^{(+1/2)})$ for input $X$.
column3: Typically, input X can be a scalar (typically between -1 and 1, exclusive of both endpoints except in the limit) or a vector (or a similar mathematical object) with a signed magnitude belonging to the previously mentioned interval; in the former case, "|X|" in the definition refers to its absolute value; in the latter case, "|X|" in the definition refers to the nonnegative magnitude of said vector (or similar object). Typically, the output is a(n extended) real number no less than 1; whether or not positive-infinity exists in the codomain is a matter of convenience, convention, and context. This definition can be extended (such as for tachyons).

column2: digit/number: Euler–Mascheroni constant, usually denoted by lowercase gamma (γ); approximately 0.5772156649 (in decimal).
column3: The difference in the limit as n becomes arbitrarily large between/of: the sum of (1/k) for all strictly positive integers k < (n+1), and the natural logarithm of n.

column2: abstractor: sensation / qualia abstractor; $x_1$ is the sensation / qualia associated with objects with property [bridi, bound to ce'u], via sense $x_2$, as sensed by $x_3$
column3: Semantically linked to {ganseti}. {lo} {ga'ei} ({ce'u}) {xunre} = {lo} {ganseti} {be} {lo} {ka} ({ce'u}) {xunre}. Is one proposed way of dealing with abstractions of colors ({zilska}) and other "elemental" sense experiences. Proposed rafsi: -gel-

column2:

{ga'i nai} - meekness

column3: Not necessarily causal; may be hypothetical.

column2:

column2: $x_{1}$ is high/up/upward in frame of reference $x_{2}$ as compared with baseline/standard height $x_{3}$.
column3: Also upper; $x_3$ is generally some defined distance above a zero point/baseline, or is that baseline itself.  See also {gapru}, {dizlo}, {cnita}, {drudi}, {farna}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a/the throat/gullet [body-part] of $x_{2}$; [metaphor: narrow(ing) opening of a deep hole].

$x_{1}$ [person/agent] is an agentive cause of event $x_{2}$; $x_{1}$ does/brings about $x_{2}$.

location tense relation/direction; upwards/up from ...
{gasnu} modal, 1st place agent/actor case tag       with active agent ...
$x_1$ pertains to Gua\spi language/culture in aspect $x_2$
$f_2$ is turned up from $g_2$ in reference frame $g_3$.
$gac_1$ is a fence gate in fence opening $v_1$=$gac_2$ between $v_2$=$b_2$=$gra_2$ and $v_4$=$b_3$=$gra_2$ (unordered), in fence $v_4$=$b_1$.
$b_1$=$g_1$ is a fence separating $b_2$=$g_2$ and $b_3$=$g_2$ (unordered) of/in structure $b_4$.
$x_1$ is obvious/easy to notice for $x_2$
column3: Additional sumti slots are probably needed. See also {jmifrili}.

column2: $k_1$=$g_3$ is a/are the whisker(s)/sensory hair(s) /vibrissa(e) attached to $k_2$=$g_1$ at body part $k_3$ for the detection of stimuli $g_2$ under conditions $g_4$.
$x1$=$s1$ feels $x2$=$g2$ to $x3$=$g1$=$s3$ under conditions $x4$=$g4$=$s4$

$x_1$ (thing/nu) feels sensory-good / is a pleasant stimulus to $x_2$
$x_1$ (event) is an illusion that deceives/tricks $x_2$ into sensing $x_3$ using sense $x_4$ under conditions x5
$x_1$=$j_1$ witnesses/testifies $x_2$=$j_2$ (du'u) about $x_3$=$j_3$ by epistemology $x_4$=$j_4$
$x_1$ is the sensori-motor stage as experienced by child $x_2$
column3: 1st stage in Jean Piaget's 4 stages of cognitive development. Between 0-2 years, a child discovers the difference between themselves and their environment. At that point, they will use their senses to learn.

column2: $x_1$ uses $x_2$ for bringing about $x_3$ (event)
$x_1$=$k_1$ is person/agent $x_2$=$g_1$'s reason/motivation/purpose for doing/bringing about $x_3$=$g_2$=$k_2$.
column3: From {gasnu} {krinu}. $x_1$ is by default known by $x_2$ at some level of consciousness; {nalsanji} {gaurki'u} may be used for when an agent's reasons for an act are truly unconscious.

column2: $t_1$ is an opportunity for $t_2$=$g_1$ to do $g_2$.
$x_1$ volitionally brings about $x_2$ (event) for purpose/goal $x_3$ (event)
$p_1$ is toilet paper.
$gl_1$ rims/performs anilingus on $gl_2$.
$x_1$ announces, proclaims $x_2$ (text, assertion) towards $x_3$
$t_1$=$g_1$ is a sign of $t_2$ showing information $t_3$ to community $g_2$
$n_3$ publishes about subject $n_2$ with message $n_1$=$g_1$ to intended audience $n_4$.
$x_1$ (text/sedu'u) is propaganda disseminated by $x_2$ (agent) to audience/community $x_3$ to influence action/state $x_4$
column3: Not necessarily negative; refers to any speech act meant to influence public opinion or behavior.

column2: $b_1$ defends country $b_2$=$g_1$ from threat/peril/potential $b_3$.
$n_2$ is a treaty between countries $n_1$=$n_3$
$j_1$ is the president of people $g_2$ in country $g_3$.
$n_1$ is a summit between $j_1$=$c_1$ (heads of state/government) about topic/subject $c_2$.
column3: x2 are usually presidents or prime ministers. x3 are points on an agenda (= snuselpla). Cf. {casnu}.

column2: $c_1$ is a supranational union of member states $g_1$=$j_1$=$c_3$
$x_1$ is a Google Group for $x_2$ to discuss/talk about subject $x_3$
$x_1$ is a Google Group for $x_2$ to discuss/talk about subject $x_3$
column3: -zam- is the rafsi of {zai'e}, indicating a jargon word, and the divorce of {girzu} from its normal meaning. Place structure based off of {snustu}.

column2: $x_1$ migrates to country $x_2$ from country $x_3$ over path/route $x_4$.
$r_1$ is abroad, located across national border $r_2$, relative to $r_3$ (default: the speaker).
column3: From {gugde} + {ragve}. If /gv/ is ever declared a valid initial consonant sequence, this word will become a {valrtosmabru} (ill-formed word that breaks apart into a {cmavo} and a {lujvo}), and will need to be replaced by {gugdyragve}.

column2: $k_1$ is a diplomat/ambassador representing country $k_2$=$g_1$ in matter(s)/function(s) $k_3$.
$p_1$ is a state/province/region (first-level administrative division) of country $p_2$=$g_1$.
column3: Cf.{gugde}, {pagbu}.  A province or region can also be a second-level administrative division; for these use {gugypausle}.

column2: $s_1$ is a county/district/parish/province (second-level administrative division) of country $s_2$=$g_1$.
column3: Cf. {gugde}, {pagbu}, {selci}. A province can also be a first-level administrative division; for this use {gugypau}, or optionally {vipygu'e} if it is in a country with a federal government.

column2: $s_1$ is quick-as-light at doing $s_2$
$g_1$=$c_1$ is sandy abrasive material.

$x_1$ is part/member of aggregate/group/mass $x_2$.
$x_1$(mass) brawls with $x_2$(mass) over issue $x_3$ (abstract)
$ga_1$ combines individual $gu_2$ into mass $gu_1$.
$gun_1$=$gug_1$ is a federative state consisting of states/lands $gun_2$
$d_1$=$g_1$ is a pool of water.
$x_1$ mass produces $x_2$ [product] by process $x_3$

See also {jbokravla} (native Lojban word) and {valsi}.

column3: In a la-description, jbovlaste refers to the online dictionary editing system.

column2: $x_1$ is the difficulty of Lojban word-making.
column3: Cf. {jbovlazbakemsedycro}. Making words in Lojban is difficult in a variety of ways, depending on what type of word you're trying to make. Proper {lujvo}-making requires a good grasp of the semantics of the relevant {gismu}; and of {tanru} syntax, especially the scope of various grammatical constructs; knowledge of Lojban morphology and phonotactics to correctly insert y-hyphens where needed and avoid unparseable wordlike forms such as *{tosmabru} and *{slinku'i} (see {valrtosmabru}, {valslinku'i}); and finally, if you want to add your word to the dictionary, facility with the lujvo-scoring algorithm. Making Type 4 {fu'ivla} (or {zi'evla}), on the other hand, presents the challenge of knowing, out of hundreds of wordlike phonological patterns, which will parse as  single-morpheme words and which will not. (For example, the nonce word {kadvati} will parse but *{kazvati} will not; {fra'aso} will but *{fra'asoi} will not; {kadnazbakai} will but {kadnazbackai} is a actually a lujvo.) Making Type 3 fu'ivla is comparatively easy, but still requires knowing how to use hyphen phonemes right and, of course, how to not violate phonotactical rules when lojbanizing foreign words. Luckily, the work of checking potential word forms can be mostly automated now, if you have access to {sutysisku} or {jbovlaste}.

discursive: 
{je'au} - correcting/corrective/correction
{je'aucu'i} - inattentive/uncaring/neutral toward the presence of possible errors
{je'aunai} - permitting (known/likely/plausible) error/incompleteness/approximation
$x1$ reflects/pertains to Dothraki culture/language/nationality in aspect $x2$
negation sumti qualifier: that which indeed is.

discursive: correcting/corrective/correction - inattentive/uncaring/neutral toward the presence of possible errors - permitting (known/likely/plausible) errordiscursive: correcting/corrective/correction - inattentive/uncaring/neutral toward the presence of possible errors - permitting (known/likely/plausible) error/incompleteness/approximation

discursive: correcting/corrective/correction - inattentive/uncaring/neutral toward the presence of possible errors - permitting (known/likely/plausible) errordiscursive: correcting/corrective/correction - inattentive/uncaring/neutral toward the presence of possible errors - permitting (known/likely/plausible) error/incompleteness/approximation
column3: Not quite lying since this construct alerts the audience in good faith to the presence of (known/plausible/likely) errors or "incomplete truths" in the utterance; the plausibility and pertinence of the presence of such errors is subject to the utterer's judgment, opinion, knowledge, philosphy, desire to draw attention to them at that stage in the discussion, belief, etc. - in other words, absolute Truth (such as in an existential sense external to the utterer) does not necessarily result in the utterance of this construct, even if errors may be present. Potentially useful for academic or technical honesty. "Error" may be rendered as "incompleteness of truth" or "approximation" in this context.
column5: allowing some room for error or incompleteness;permitting known errors

It was felt more appropriate to make a word meaning "work holiday" and leave the days/week[s] to be specified by the person.

$x_1$ is a region/room/volume of space which is shaped like a washer (or thin or flattened torus/toroid), between inner disk/sphere $x_2$ and outer disk/sphere $x_3$, defined by midplane $x_4$, and containing $x_5$.
column3: $x_1$ {canlu}. This word contrasts with "{torxesu}" in that, while neither is necessarily a material object, this is a region of space and not an idealized object per se, and that, while this region is technically three-dimensional, it is mostly considered to be flat or nearly two-dimensional (similar to "{karda}"). Therefore, it will not take up/fill all of the space between the inner and outer spheres; it is confined approximately to the plane $x_4$. $x_3$ should enclose $x_2$ (except at most one point unless the case be degenerate), but they need not be mutually concentric. $x_1$ need not be perfectly circularly toroidal; for example, it could be elliptical (in which case, $x_2$ or $x_3$ would not be perfectly spherical either). Contrast with "{bolbi'i}", which is the whole region between the spheres $x_2$ and $x_3$ when this word makes sense, but which also does not require the nesting of the said spheres. This word is a {brapagjvo}; see: "{jinrcaiba}", "{belta}". Consider just using either "{djine}" (for an object) or "{jinca'u}" (for a region of space).

column3: jirnytabra refers generally to the common horn (brass instrument). "..the instrument is often informally known as the French horn. However, this is technically incorrect since the instrument is not French in origin, but German. Therefore, the International Horn Society has recommended since 1971 that the instrument be simply called the horn." (wikipedia). Also natural horn (=sampu jirnytabra), vienna horn (=vin zei jirnytabra or {tabrviena}), mellophone (={tabrmelofono}), wagner tuba ({tabrvagnri}). See also {jirna} and {tabra}.

column3: $x_1$ is a space/directed graph/set of ordered n-tuples which is formed from the endowment of of a space/set (of possible nodes) $x_2$ with the relationship $x_3$ which is n-ary.  Suppose that $x_2$ is binary; let y and z be elements in $x_2$ and denote $x_3$ by "R" so that "a R b" means that R relates 'a' to 'b' in that order (not necessarily the reverse); then: if y R z, then (y,z) is an element in $x_1$. In other words, $x_1$ is the set of exactly all ordered edges between members of $x_2$ (which are nodes/endpoints of members of $x_1$), which are formed iff R relates those members in the order indicated by the direction of the edge (source then destination; first term, then second term) when R is binary. Greater arity is possible (in which case ordered n-tuples become useful and edges scale up dimensionally). $x_1$ is the set of all ordered relationships in $x_2$ formed by $x_3$. One valjvo of this word is an experimental gismu: {grafu}.

column2: In the sequence $x_1$, each nonfinal member is related to the next member by the relation $x_2$.
$x_1$ is a fidget spinner.
$x_1$ plays croquet against $x_2$ in competition $x_3$ for prize/title $x_4$.
$x_1$ is a slinky (toy).
$x_1$ reflects Manx culture in aspect $x_2$
$x_{1}$ is $x_{2}$ degrees Fahrenheit in temperature by standard $x_{3}$.
$x_1$ is a black hole/singularity with radius of event horizon $x_2$
column3: This is a word based on the cultural idea of a black hole, and so contains places of cultural importance, rather than the physical characteristics that define a black hole. It is a shortening of {kensa} {jipno} {se} {farlu} into a {jbofuvi}. See {gramykemjipselfa'u}.

column2: $x_1$ is to $x_2$ as $x_3$ is to $x_4$ as $x_5$ is to $x_6$ ...
column3: Takes an even number of arguments (is 2n-ary). Also means: x1 is an x2 type of x3. More widely known as a kenning; x1 : x2 :: x3 : x4 :: x5 : x6... One can use sequences ({ce'o}) as x2, x4, x6 if more than 2 things form a row.

column2: $x_1$ is an anthropomorphic animal of type/species $x_2$
$x_1$ is a centaur/hippocentaur of type/mythology $x_2$
$x_1$ is a kerbal.
column3: Kerbals are the alien species starred in the celebrated space flight simulator video game Kerbal Space Program. See also {kesli'uci'e} {jakne} {kesyvinji} {spoja} {bebna}

column2: $x_1$ (quantity) is a hair cleaning/care/maintenance/styling substance/product for purpose $x_2$ of composition $x_3$; $x_1$ is a quantity of hair product
column3: This word is something of an {u'ivla}. Not restricted to only shampoo (hair cleaning product); can include (but is not limited to): shampoo, conditioner, hair mousse/gel, hair replenisher/grower (for baldness), hair coloring dye, hair styling spray, and even shaving cream/foam; however, it should be a tool/substance applied to hair semi-permanently, rather than applied to it only initially in order to modify it for later (such as a crimper, curler, etc.)—in other words, kerfrcampu remains with the hair or is scrubbed in and then washed out in order to function. Hair need not be human, of the top of the head, or even "real"/biological/belonging to the individual in question—these characteristics may be specified by $x_2$. See also {krevelylu'i}; {campu} for gismu version of same word.
column5: hair conditioner;hair dye;hair gel;hair mousse;hair product;hair spray;hair styling substance;shampoo

column2: $x_1$ is Cornish in aspect $x_2$
$x_1$ (set) is the set of all points/input values in the domain of function $x_2$ such that that function ($x_2$) maps them to 0.
column3: $x_1$ is a subset of the domain set of $x_2$.

column2: $x_1$ is a kernel/nucleus/'nut' of $x_2$; $x_1$ is central
$x_1$ is an (Internet) meme about $x_2$ using format $x_3$.
column3: Refers to Internet memes about a topic (se kibmeme) using a repeating format, e.g. "Drake Hotline approves" (te kibmeme). See also {sibvidru}.

column2: $x_1$ is a web browser.
$x_1$ and $x_2$ are such that the former is in relation $x_3$ with a greater number than that which the latter is in that relation with.

$x_1$ is in relation $x_4$ with $x_2$ to the $x_3$th degree; $x_1$ is $x_3$ nodes before $x_2$ in the sequence such that every element thereof and the next element are linked by the relation $x_4$; $x_1$ is [ that which is in relation $x_4$ with ] (repeat $x_3$ times the part between brackets) $x_2$
column3: X ki'inmoi Y li ci lo ka ce'u ce'u pendo = X is a friend of a friend of a friend of Y (so a "third degree friend"). X ki'inmoi Y li vo lo ka ce'u ce'u mamta = X is the mother of the mother of the mother of the mother of Y; X is [the mother of]×4 Y.

column2: Canada
Keresth

digit/number: hex digit E (decimal 14) [fourteen].
column3: Used as an alternative to {rei}/{xei} due to unique consonant. Useful in crowded situations. Experimental rafsi: -kim-

column2: non-logical connective/mekso operator - of arity only 1 xor 2: set (absolute) complement, or set exclusion (relative complement). Unary: $X_{2} ^{C}$; binary: ${X_1}\setminus{X_2}$.
column3: Each input must be a set or similar. The definition of the binary case expands to "the set of exactly those elements which are in $X_1$ but not in $X_2$". This word and operator has ordered input: '$X_1$ kei'i $X_2$' is not generally equivalent to '$X_2$ kei'i $X_1$'; in other words, the operator is not commutative. If unary (meaning that $X_1$ is not explicitly specified in a hypothetical expression "${X_1}\setminus{X_2}$"), then $X_1$ is taken to be some universal set $O$ in/of the discourse (of which all other mentioned or relevantly formable sets are subsets, at the least); in this latter case, the word operates as the set (absolute) complement of the explicitly mentioned set here designated as $X_2$ for clarity (id est: the output is $O\setminus{X_2}={X_2}^{C}$, where "$^{C}$" denotes the set absolute complement; in other words, it is the set of all elements which may be under consideration such that they are not elements of the explicitly specified set). When binary with both $X_1$ and $X_2$ explicitly specified, this word/operator is the set relative complement. This word is somewhat analogous to, depending on its arity, logical 'NOT' or 'AND NOT' (just as set intersection is analogous to logical 'AND', set union is analogous to logical '(AND/)OR'  and set symmetric difference is analogous to 'XOR'). The preferred description/name in English is "set (theoretic) exclusion". See also: "{kleivmu}". For reference: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Complement_(set_theory) .
column5: \;absolute complement;C;exclusion;relative complement;set complement;set difference;set exclusion;set minus;set subtraction

column2: quaternion j
column3: Works like {ka'o} (as a comma) and is isomorphic to it. See also: {ka'o}, {kai'o}, {koi'o}, {kau'o}.

column2: vocative: please repeat in simpler words.
vocative: please repeat over and over in a soft tone that puts me in a trance
column3: And make my mind spin round and round, 'til it knows naught but your voice's sound

column2: reverses modification order of contained tanru (does not affect lujvo).
column3: Marks a "selskiski"/"military-style"/"noun-adjective" tanru, i.e. {tertau} come *before* {seltau}. This differs from {co} in that it does not affect the place structure of the sumti to the right; i.e. in {mi ke'oi broda brode do} (= {mi brode broda do}), both {mi} and {do} are arguments of {broda}. Default grouping is still left: {lo ke'oi ckule nixli cmalu melbi} resolves to {lo ke'oi (((ckule nixli) cmalu) melbi)}, which is equivalent to {lo melbi ke cmalu ke nixli ckule}. {co} does not (re-)reverse the order of tanru-modification; it only changes place structure. See {ke'e'u}.

column2: vocative: please repeat more slowly / more clearly enunciated.
vocative: please repeat in a language I understand better.

Cf. {selfla}, {selzi'e}, {terzi'e}, {selzau}, {selpikta}.

column3: Violated right $k_1$ (event) may be implied by x4. The harm/violation must be by sexual activity (what one would consider {gletu}) and must be sexual in nature. Need not be violent. Harm may not be physical or even psychological/mental/emotional; it need only be a 'harm to one's rights' (in other words, a violation of loi {krali}). {krali} is an experimental gismu.  The mutual symmetry of gle1 and gle2 is lost/broken by the harmer-victim relationship enforced by this word (and, specifically, xai1 and xai2=k2). See also: {glexai}, {xaigle}, {vilgle}, {glevlile}, {glevilxaigau}, {glekrali}, {glecu'akrali}, {glekralyxai}, {kralyxai}.

This word is morphologically interpreted as a lujvo at this time.

$x_1$ is ornamentation related to/composing/pertaining to/forming an element of interior design/room content arrangement/home decoration (including wall decorations, accent walls, and focus items/centerpieces) and/or structural design/blueprint for $x_2$ (particular room/structure) in larger structure (such as building) $x_3$, that is done for purely aesthetic (as opposed to functional) reasons
column3: This ornamentation may also be expressed through the design of the space itself (it's shape, etc.); thus the definition here is wider than {kumjoibimselvauja'i}, which is only the decoration of the room via the inclusion and arrangement of certain contents and coloring the walls. In other words: this word includes physical changes/renovations to or choices for a structure, which are relatively hard to perform, as well as the arrangement of the contents of its interior (which is easier and is the meaning of the alternative word).

column2: $x_1$ is ornamentation related to/composing/pertaining to/forming an element of interior design/room content arrangement/home decoration (including wall decorations, accent walls, and focus items/centerpieces), but not a structural design/blueprint, for $x_2$ (particular room/structure) in larger structure (such as building) $x_3$
column3: This is interior decoration. This is something that can be changed over the course of a weekend by a small number of people. It is a type of {kumjoibimja'i}.

column2: $x_1$ is cloisonné ornamentation on $x_2$ that exhibits cloisons/cloisters/compartments/cells/separated box regions (filled with/meant for) $x_2$ and with separating barriers $x_3$ (usually metal).
column3: The existence of actual raised barriers is important.  These are not just disparate and distinct regions touching one another and transitioning sharply across the interface (this would be the case murals, brickwork, art made from magnetic phase domains, etc.). The wall is an emphasized part of the decoration; in fact, it is thick and the compartments/cloison do not touch eachother. An additional layer of metal may be laid over top for added ornamentation.

column3: Refers to any kind of inappropriate reliance upon English in a Lojban (or non-English language) expression, but is most common for calques. Is sometimes even extended to cover reliance upon cultural assumptions. This lujvo is made to have more-specific rafsi-connotations than the historical lujvo-term "malglico" (under {malgli}), and to avoid possible clashing with the common lujvo construction of "malbroda" meaning "d**ned broda / broda in a bad way". The $xl_2$ place is also useful, allowing (mi se malglixlu) and (di'u malglixlu mi)

$x_1$ is related to medical treatment/science/practice, or is medicinal, or is medical, or is related to healthcare, or is related to the practice/occupation of medicine or being a medical practitioner (doctor, nurse, midwife, pharmacist, technician, etc.; also: psychologists, psychiatrists, physical therapists, physicians, veterinarians, hospital administrators, vel sim.), or pertains to hospitals or caregiving, concerning general class of subjects/patients $x_2$ or ailment/body-part $x_3$ or form of treatment/care $x_4$.
column3: No implication that the subject is human. For veterinarian, $x_2$ is non-human animals in general or some subset thereof. Dentistry, orthodontics, optometry, epidemiology, etc. all are included. Plant or agricultural science related to taking care of ailing plants or preventing their ailments is included ($x_2$ is plants (and possibly fungi)). All reproductive or fertility sciences or services, excepting sex work or similar, are included; obstetrics and reproductive health are included; family planning, abortion services, and contraception science or services are included. Palliative, hospice, and euthanization care are included. Mental health and wellness care, in the form of therapy or similar, is included. This list is not exhaustive.

There are no implications about its structure; thus, this term is broader than "organic compound" in the sense that it does not require the presence of carbon, hydrogen, or any halogens, but it is potentially narrower than such a term in the sense that the compound really should at least be typically or historically associated with life or produced thereby. See also: "{mivyselkra}" and "{xumsle}".

See also: {rokybixmivborvelvi'u} for not "fresh"/petrified/fossilized remains.

column3: $x_1$ identifies their social gender as $x_2$ [a man, a woman, non-binary (i.e. neither, but still exhibits gendered behaviour), agender (opts out of gender)]. Gender here denotes a social role loosely defined as a combination of how one relates to others socially/societally and how one presents oneself. Gender here is not determined by chromosomal makeup, genital configuration, or sexual/romantic orientation of $x_1$. $x_2$ can contain such verbs as {nanmu} - 'male', {ninmu} - 'female', {mlini'u} - 'demi-girl' (only loosely feminine), {mlinau} - 'demi-guy' (only loosely masculine), {cenba} - 'genderfluid', genderqueer, {nunmu} = 'non-binary' and 'agender'. See also: {tracinse}.

column3: $x_3$ is 'primary' only in a grammatical sense; this designation does not imply anything about the legal or actual interpersonal relationships, expectations, etc. involved between $x_3$ and either of $x_1$ or $x_2$. In fact, $x_3$ could be a deadbeat parent to $x_2$ too. This word can be used for the terms "baby daddy", "baby momma", etc., but only in the strictly derogatory sense; for a more neutral connotation of the same, just use "{ternrorci}". The co-parent need not actually be absent or a deadbeat, but some negative feeling is connoted by this word; the co-parent (rather than 'primary' parent) relationship is important to the meaning – the "mal-" seltau has broken the symmetry between rorci$_1$ and rorci$_2$.
